loans.name: Hannatu

texts.en: Hannatu is a Babban Gona farmer from Kurmi. Hannatu expressed that she is driven by one goal; to “ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Hannatu to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, she finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Hannatu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Hannatu, is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Hannatu will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what she plans to do with her income from this season, she said: “I plan to use the money I make to build a better home”. With this loan, Hannatu will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Shehu Dandikko

texts.en: Shehu Dandikko remembers not being able to feed his family  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Shehu Dandikko, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Shehu Dandikko  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs” expressed Shehu Dandikko   With this loan, Shehu Dandikko is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet has been working on their own farm for many years while her husband works as a driver to make a living. With her generated income from farm produce, she was able to repay successfully her previous loans used for farming. Planning to improve the farm, she took a new loan recently to buy fertilizer and to cover the costs for weeding maintenance. Juliet hopes to increase her harvest so as to take care of her family’s daily needs and to purchase additional farmland as well. This picture was taken with her motorcycle used for transporting her purchased stocks.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to cover the costs for weeding maintenance.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ari Mpya Group

texts.en:
Amos is in his late twenties and is single. He has been a tailor and sells clothes materials, a business he has been in since 2006. Working from 7 am to 7 pm daily, he is able to make a good profit each month. 

Amos is requesting a second loan via Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous credit to buy clothes making materials and a new tailoring machine. He managed to receive extra income which he used to cover his welfare cost. In the coming years, Amos would like to manage a tailoring firm. He will use this loan to buy clothes making materials.  

He will share this loan with his group "ARI MPYA" which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes making materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Tungalagtuya

texts.en: Tungalagtuya, 47 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been selling shoes to local people since 2004 and gets her goods from a China city near the border. Her husband is a craftsman and works at a souvenir shop. Their elder son just graduated from  university and is looking for job. Her younger son studies at university and also helps with her business during the weekend. She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy shoes in large quantity as the academic year is approaching. Then she can continue to sell her shoes without worrying about an inventory shortage. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy shoes in large quantity.

loans.name: Len's Group

texts.en: Kampong Cham province is the residential area of Len and her family, consisting of eight children. Her family relies mostly on their paid working jobs at a brick kiln site. She has involved in farming for ages and can earn up to 31,000 KHR per day. Len and her co-borrower, in a group of two, have been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for one loan successfully repaid. Now, Len is a group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion in order to buy rubber tree seedlings for growing. She hopes that this new type of business will improve her income than before

loans.use: To buy rubber tree seedlings for growing.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Haruna Maikaji

texts.en: Haruna Maikaji remembers not being able to pay his debt  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Haruna Maikaji, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Haruna Maikaji  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community” expressed Haruna Maikaji   With this loan, Haruna Maikaji is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Muhiba

texts.ru: Мухиба целеустремленная женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Мухиба планирует организовать свой бизнес купле продажей фруктов и овощей, так как овощи и фрукты имеют большой спрос на местном рынке. Она с такой целью обучилась в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она будет торговать на местном рынке. Ее муж будет помогать ей введению бизнеса. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки овощей и фруктов. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Muhiba is a goal-driven woman. She is married and raising 2 children. Muhiba plans to organize her own business in reselling fruits and vegetables because fruits and vegetables are in high demand at a local market. To achieve this goal, she completed the "Achieve Success" course, organized by the Association of Business Women, and obtained a certificate. She will be selling produce at a local market. Her husband will help her with running the business. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to buy vegetables and fruits. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to start her own business

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo es un hombre de 51 años de edad casado, tiene seis hijos y su negocio es la pesca de pejerrey.
Él es una persona sencilla humilde, muy paciente a la hora de la pesca, su buen humor va acompañado de risas, su trabajo lo realiza en el lago Titicaca a una altura aproximada de cuatro mil metros sobre el nivel del mar, él es originario de la comunidad ‘Karapata’ que se encuentra ubicado a orillas del lugar, su lengua materna es el aymara y utiliza el español para el comercio.
Ricardo es de tez morena, cabello negro corto y estatura mediana, su hijo mayor se encuentra  prestando su servicio en el cuartel militar. Los tres hijos siguientes colaboran tanto en la pesca como en el comercio y sus dos hijos menores son muy pequeños y se encuentra al cuidado de su esposa.
Su especialidad es la pesca de pejerrey de agua dulce(con redes y anzuelo), una variedad introducida al lago para el beneficio de sus pobladores, esta especie es muy demandada en la zona por propios y visitantes.
Ricardo no cuenta con capital económico para realizar una inversión en su negocio, los gastos de alimentación y de estudios de sus hijos son muchos.
Es por esos motivos que Ricardo solicita un préstamo para la compra de redes de pesca y con los beneficios pagar los gastos de sus seis hijos.
texts.en:
Ricardo is a 51-year-old man, he is married, has 6 children, and his business is fishing for mackerel. He is a modest and unassuming person. He is very patient when fishing, he is always in a good mood and laughs a lot.

He fishes in lake Titcaca, at approximately 4,000 metros above sea level. He was born in the community of Karapata, which is located on the banks of the lake, and his native language is Aymara. He uses Spanish for trading.

Ricardo has dark skin, short black hair and his of medium height. His oldest son is in the military service. The next three children help with the fishing as well as with selling the fish, and his two youngest children are still very small and his wife cares for them.

His specialty is the fishing for mackerel in freshwater (with nets and baits). This fish species was introduced into the lake for the benefit of the people who live there. It is very popular with the locals and with visitors. 

Ricardo does not have the financial means to invest in his business and to pay for the food and education of his children.

These are the reasons why Ricardo asks for a loan: to buy fishing nets and, with the profit he makes, to pay for what his 6 children need.

loans.use: to buy fising nets and by this make profit to pay for the expenses he has for his six children.

loans.name: Alisabatu

texts.en: Alisabatu remembers feeling depressed  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before she became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Alisabatu, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Alisabatu  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family” expressed Alisabatu   With this loan, Alisabatu is well on her way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Nhóm 9 Thôn 4 Quảng Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs Oanh works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

Mrs. Oanh is 45 years old and married with 3 children. 

She lives  in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.  She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years, and the main hardship that she faces is the lack of capital. 

In 2013, Oanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 2 loans from FPW. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 9 Thôn 4 Quảng Hải Group solidarity group, which consists of 5 members.

With her business profit, Oanh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Khuriniso

texts.ru:
Хуринисо бизнеследи с района Дангара. Ей 41 год. Она замужем и имеет двоих сыновей в возрасте 18 и 16 лет, а также 6-летнюю дочь. Хуринисо на рынке района имеет торговую точку и в течение 7 лет занимается там продажей тканей и материалов для шитья платьев. Ее торговля идет хорошо независимо от сезона, так как многие женщины предпочитают покупать ткани и шить из них платья на свой размер и вкус. Хуринисо в бизнесе помогают ее муж и старший сын. 
Сейчас Хуринисо хочет увеличить ассортимент летних тканей с целью увеличения объема продаж. Для этой цели она нуждается в кредите, так как собственное сбережение маленькое. Она надеется получить финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Khuriniso is a businesswoman from the Dangara district. She is 41 years old. She is married and has two sons, who are 18 and 16 years old, and a 6-year-old daughter. Khuriniso has had a retail outlet, where she sells fabrics and materials for sewing dresses, at a district market for 7 years. Her sales are always going well regardless of the season because many women prefer to buy fabrics and sew dresses in accordance with their size and taste. Khuriniso's husband and oldest son help her with the business.

Now Khuriniso wants to expand the selection of summer fabrics in order to increase her sales volume. She needs a loan to achieve this goal because she has very little personal savings. She hopes to obtain financial support.

loans.use: to buy a selection of summer fabrics in order to increase her sales volume

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm implements.

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en: Amadu is a Babban Gona farmer from Pegi. Amadu is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is this ambition that led Amadu to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Amadu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Amadu is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 40 bags per hectare this season because with this loan, he will finally be able to access the required yield enhancing inputs such as improved seeds. Amadu is hoping that as a result of this expected yield, he will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what changes he would like to make, he said “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland.  Ultimately, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, Amadu will be able to access all the inputs and services to make these dreams reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Baraka

texts.en:
Baraka is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

Baraka has operated a beauty salon business for the past three years, operating at the market serving passersby and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to add stock of hair gels, hair treatments and combs into her beauty salon business. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to add stock of hair gels, hair treatments and combs to her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Caridad Bonna

texts.en:
Caridad Bonna lives at Pallua Sur with her mother. She is 40 years old and single. She devotes herself to selling vegetables and other grocery items for income. Her income goes for meals and bills at home, such as those for electricity and water. She also gives allowances for school to her nephews. 

Caridad aims for continous business so she can save funds for her family, especially for her mother who needs medicines for maintenance. She is now asking for additinal capital of PHP 35,000 to buy eggplant, beans, tomatoes, meat and soft drinks to sell. This will improve her sales and income as well.

loans.use: to buy eggplant, beans, tomatoes, meat and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Alkein

texts.en:
Alkein is studying at a university in order to reach his dream of having a better career in the future. He often helps his parents in their business selling fish in the market. Their income has been good enough for their daily expenditures and some school expenses. 

Alkein's previous loan was used for paying his tuition fees for the previous semester. He is determined to become successful, for he has a heart for helping his parents in the future. Recently, he took a new loan to pay his tuition fee for the first semester of the upcoming school year.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fee for the first semester.

loans.name: Philibus

texts.en: Philibus is a Babban Gona farmer from Juri. Philibus expressed that he is driven by one goal; to “ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Philibus to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. By doing so, Philibus will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to provide more food and clothing for my family”. With this loan, Philibus will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando, al trabajar la tierra bajo un sol agotador sin embargo dispuesto a sudar todo el tiempo para brindarle un mejor futuro a sus dos hijos de 4 y 1 año.

Joven de 26 años y hombre responsable, se dedica a la elaboración de canastas en Sololá, con el que sustenta a su familia.  Sin embargo, todos los días parándose sobre su terreno, abriga la esperanza de un sueño interior de capitalizar más cuerdas de terreno para continuar su trabajo en la agricultura.

El préstamo que necesita es para la compra de semillas o insumos agrícolas que lo ayudará a darle un mejor futuro a su familia, ese futuro que vive mirando mientras trabaja en sus canastos.
texts.en:
Fernando works the land under a grueling sun, but is willing to put in the sweat to provide a better future for his two children, who are 4 and 1 years old. He is 26 years old, and a responsible young man, who weaves baskets in Sololá, to support his family. However, every day while standing on his land, he dreams of buying more land to additionally work in farming. 

The loan he is requesting is to purchase seeds or other farming supplies to help give his family a better future, that future that he now only dreams about while weaving the baskets.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies

loans.name: Samaila Nigger

texts.en: Samaila Nigger remembers not being able to pay school fees  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Samaila Nigger  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs” expressed Samaila Nigger   With this loan, Samaila Nigger is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Muhammadu Nura

texts.en: Muhammadu Nura is a 30-year- old farmer from Gangarida. As a Babban Gona member, Muhammadu Nura, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Muhammadu Nura can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the National average of 14. However, Muhammadu Nura is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Muhammadu Nura said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children; Wasila,   Fahat, and  Aliyu, and in 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Juan Benjamin

texts.es:
Juan tiene 30 años de edad vive en el cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolivar  su estado civil es casado vive con su esposa y sus hijos de 1 y 2 años. 
Es integrante de la ventanilla rural Ambrocio Laso que se dedica a las labores agricolas.

Juan se dedica a la agricultura y siembra de maíz papas y también a la crianza de pollos utilizara el dinero del crédito para ciclo corto con el apoyo del crédito incrementar su negocio, el realiza las compras  de insumos en Chimbo. 
su sueños es tener un carro para llevar a vender lo que cosecha el enfrentara los desafíos que se le presenten en la vida en su tiempo libre se dedica al deporte.
texts.en:
Juan is 30 years old, and he lives in the San Miguel Canton, in the Bolívar Province. He is married, and he lives with his wife and his children, ages one and two. He is a member of the Ambrocio Laso Communal Bank, which is dedicated to agricultural activities. Juan works in agriculture, cultivating potatoes and corn, and he also raises chickens.

He will use the money from the loan for the short cycle, and with the support of the loan, increase his business. He will purchase the supplies in Chimbo. His dream is to have a vehicle for transporting his harvest to market. He will face the challenges that may arise in life. He devotes his free time to sports.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Ado

texts.en: Ado remembers the depression he felt  during a particularly bad harvest. This is before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, as a Babban Gona member, Ado like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14. However, Ado,  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  Ado expressed that “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, Ado is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

texts.en: La'azaru remembers not being able to feed his family during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona member. Now, La'azaru, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. With this loan, La'azaru is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is aged 55, married to a construction worker, and blessed with three children. 

She has managed a food vending business in their village for almost ten years and earns a net income of PHP 400 daily. Her income from this business was saved for future emergencies. 

Due to lack of capital to use in her business, she would like to request a loan amounting to PHP 8,000 to purchase food ingredients for her business such as hotdogs, raw meat, chickens, tomatoes, and hot dog sticks. 

She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and expand so that she can earn more profits.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients for her business such as hot dogs, raw meat, chickens, tomatoes, and hot dog sticks.

loans.name: Sopio

texts.en:
Sopio is 37 years old. She lives in the small village of Kaspi district with her husband, an infant child, and mother-in-law. Her mother-in-law has chronic health problems and gets small monthly assistance from the local government institutions, which is hardly enough to cover her monthly medicine expenses. The family belongs to the subsistence poor category, since they have no source of income and live under poverty.  Due to the above-mentioned situation, Sopio is not able to receive credit from the local financial providers to start a business.  

Sopio's request has now been approved within the framework of Kiva and Credo and she is able to use the start-up loan to set up a store located near her house, where she will trade fruits and vegetables. The loan of GEL 3,000 will help her to purchase a stock of fruits and vegetables. Sopio will also purchase piglets to raise. 

After the store is opened, the family will have a stable income, which enables them to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in the future. Along with the store, Sopio will actively be involved in the husbandry business to raise piglets and expand this business in the future, for more income.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 57 years old and lives in Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with seven children now at their adult age. 

She has engaged in managing a sari-sari store that sells groceries and other consumable products for three years already and earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stocks of groceries and other consumable goods for retail.

Norma has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to expand her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: purchase additional stocks of groceries and other consumable goods

loans.name: Primigilia

texts.en:
Primigilia is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.

To earn a living, she has a business selling BBQ. She earns about 5,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan to purchase raw ingredients for her food-vending business.

Primigilia has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, she would like to have her own store.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Maryamu

texts.en: Maryamu remembers not being able to feed her family  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before she became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Maryamu, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Maryamu  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 15 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community” expressed Maryamu   With this loan, Maryamu is well on her way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Shaabu

texts.en: Shaabu is a Babban Gona farmer from Nassarawa. Shaabu expressed that he is driven by one goal; to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Shaabu to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Shaabu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Shaabu, is ambitious and is aiming to reap yields higher than both the national and Babban Gona averages. By doing so, Shaabu will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland.” With this loan, Shaabu will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Zakariya

texts.en: Zakariya is a Babban Gona farmer from Nassarawa. Zakariya expressed that he is driven by one goal; to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Zakariya to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Zakariya can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Zakariya, is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 60 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Zakariya will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland”. With this loan, Zakariya will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Yoeurn

texts.en:
Yoeurn is 64 years old and lives in a community of Prey Chhor District of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. As a father of two dependent children and five married children, he is still working very hard in his own rice field. He grows rice and sells the product to the local dealers. The net profit that he can generate is $5 a day.

In the last five years, Yoeurn has been saving some money to pay for new home construction. Right now, the saved money is still not sufficient. Therefore, Yoeurn would like to request a loan from Kiva to build a house.

He thanks lenders for the financial support through Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) which provides him with a much lower interest rate than those of the general loan products.

loans.use: to build a house

loans.name: Saophorn

texts.en:
Saophorn is 46 years old and is an experienced and industrious farmer. She is from Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province. 

She is a lovely mother of two married children and one adolescent who is attending a high school in the village. By operating a farming business on a small rice field, she can earn around $7 a day to support her family's daily expenses. So far, Saophorn has been involved in this career for nearly 20 years.

To keep her rice growing well and to be more fruitful, Saophorn is going to use natural fertilizers on her farmland. Due to the shortage of money, she would like to get a Kiva loan via Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) to buy fertilizers to use in her farming process during this farming season. 

She thanks all the lenders for their generous behaviors.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Lenders! Meet Joseph, 54 years of age, who lives with his life partner and their four children in the Kitale area of Kenya. This area is considered a very fertile area and is “the bread basket “area of Kenya because half of the food that Kenya consumes comes from this area. 

Joseph has been doing farming for the past six years, and through those years, he has gained so much experience and most villagers look up to him because of his hardworking traits. His primary source of income is milk selling, egg selling, and some personal business so that he can make ends meet.

Joseph enjoys taking care of his cows and has even nicknamed one of them “Nyeusi” which means black because his cow has black and white patches.

Kitale is an area that has a high demand for milk and the supply is low because the population is high. That is why Joseph is seeking a loan of KES 50,000 to buy a dairy cow. Through the loan, he will be able to satisfy the increasing client base and the already-developed market that is there and be able to fully support his family.

Through increased profits from selling milk, Joseph is sure that he will satisfy his family's needs and he will not need any financial assistance from anybody.

Joseph plans to accumulate more  profits and buy more dairy cows and also employ people to help him in his farm. Therefore, he will be empowering others economically.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Phuon

texts.en:
Phuon is a 24-year-old married woman who has three dependent children. She lives in the Bakan District of Pursat Province which is located in the western part of Cambodia. 

To earn a living, she and her husband manage a rice farming business which is the sole source of their income. So far, they have been in this occupation for five years with an average income of $5 a day. 

Phuon wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use because there is no latrine in her house now. So, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine and buy its facilities. 

By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

She is thankful for the loan granted through Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) with a much lower interest rate than its other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en:
Sitha is 31 years old and a married woman with two children. She lives in the Bakan District of Pursat Province which is located in the western part of Cambodia. 

To earn a living, she and her husband manage a rice farming business on approximately one and a half hectares of farmland. It is the sole source of their income. So far, they have been in this occupation for 10 years. 

Sitha wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use because there is no latrine in her house now. So, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine and buy its facilities. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

She is thankful for the loan granted through Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) with a much lower interest rate than its other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Maria Orbelina

texts.es: María, mantiene su negocio de venta de comida funcionando y en la actualidad ya tiene más cliente, por lo que su demanda es mayor y necesita tener bien abastecido su inventario, para hacerlo, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, con el comprara carnes, pollo, embutidos, condimentos, verduras, gaseosas, azúcar, sal, aceite, gas propano, pescado, etc., son materiales importantes para elaborar los diferentes platillos, espera tener los buenos resultados del préstamo anterior como mejores ganancias, nuevos clientes y una vida familiar más confortable.
texts.en:
María is keeping her food-sales business running. At this time, she already has more customers, so demand is greater and she needs to have her inventory well-stocked. To do that, she decided on another loan, with which she will buy meat, chicken, cold cuts, condiments, meats, sodas, sugar, salt, oil, propane gas, fish, etc. They are important materials for making different dishes. 

María hopes to have good results as she did with the previous loan, like better profits, new customers, and a more comfortable family life.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, cold cuts, condiments, vegetables, sodas, sugar, salt, oil, propane gas, fish, etc.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda manages a variety store and fish vending business. She is happily married and blessed with three children. Her husband is a fisherman.

Melinda would like to seek additional capital of 14,000 PHP to use to buy grocery items such as sugar, beverages, condiments, milk, and Nescafe to sell.

She is hoping that with this loan she can increase her profits, have a better way of living, and satisfy her customer demand.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as sugar, beverages, condiments, milk, and Nescafe to sell.

loans.name: Los Garci Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario lo integran tres socios laboriosos y es coordinado por la señora Mayra de 31 años de edad y casada, quien se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva en su comunidad desde hace ocho años y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de jean kalua, jean big time, camisetas, camisolas, talladores, bóxer, tobilleras, bóxer, vestidos, faldas, etc., la socia con los créditos anteriores ha logrado superarse porque genera un ingreso y aporta a los gastos del hogar. Los otros socios son los señores Manuel de 52 años de edad propietario de una pulpería en su domicilio y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de granos básicos, y Juan Rafael de 36 años de edad quien elabora canastos de bambú desde hace doce años y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de varas de bambú.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three enterprising partners. It is lead by Marya. She is 31 years old, married, and her business of eight years is the sale of new clothes in her community. 

She asks for a loan for the purchase of Kahlua jeans, Big Time jeans, t-shirts, sports shirts, halter tops, boxer shorts, ankle bracelets, dresses, skirts, etc. With her earlier loans, Marya has managed to get ahead beacuse the has an income and contributes to the household expenses.

The other partners are Manuel, who is 52 years old, has a grocery store at his home and asks for a loan to buy bulk grains, and Juan Rafael, who is 36 years old, makes artisan baskets and asks for a loan to buy bamboo sticks.

loans.use: to buy shirts, jeans, halter tops, etc.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada is married with five children. She is 43-years-old and lives in the Philippines.

Diosdada is a farmer and grows flowers to earn a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She requested a loan to use as additional capital  to buy fertilizers for her flower garden.

Diosdada has been a member of PMPC for seven years. Diosdada hopes to become successful in her flower gardening business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her flower garden

location.town: Pagadian - Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en: Eddie has been cultivating his one hectare of rice farmland for 20 years. He is 51 years old and married with four children. Eddie aims to have a plentiful yield this next harvest season so he is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000. This loan will be used to buy farm inputs such as insecticides, fertilizers and herbicides. He is looking forward to the approval of his requested loan to keep his rice field productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as insecticides, fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is 36-years-old and lives in Navalan, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with three children.

Nimfa sells various types of home products. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan to use as additional capital for her business, to buy more stock to resell.

She has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Nimfa hopes to become successful in her direct selling business and be able to build her own shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock to resell

location.town: Pagadian - Navalan, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Maura Nohemy

texts.es:
Maura es una señora de 30 años de edad, es ama de casa y estudió hasta sexto grado, no pudo continuar sus estudios por la pobreza en que sus padres vivían, ahora en día es una mujer casada y es madre de tres hijos de 13, 8 y 2 años de edad de los cuales dos se encuentran estudiando y uno que aun no estudia, por lo tanto los tres dependen de Maura. Su esposo se dedica a la albañilería mientras que ella se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de pollos desde hace diez años, trabajo que aprendió de sus padres los que siempre se dedicaron a este oficio, Maura trabaja en el horario de 7:00 am a 4:00 pm todos los días.
El préstamo que esta solicitando Maura en CREDICAMPO, es para la compra de concentrado para 150 pollos los cuales piensa en venderlos de seis semanas, con eso ella mejorara sus ingresos y podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
El sueño de Maura es aumentar la granja de pollos para ayudar a su familia y dar un mejor estudio a sus tres hijos hasta que sean unos profesionales y así podrán tener mas oportunidades de vida, poder construir una mejor vivienda a futuro.
texts.en:
Maura is 30 years old.  She is a housewife and studied through sixth grade.   She could not stay in school because of her parents poverty.  Today Maura is a married woman and the mother of three children, who are 13, 8 and 2 years old, two in school and one who doesn't go to school.  Because of this, all three depend on Maura.  Her husband earns a living as a bricklayer while she has worked at farming and raising chickens since she was ten years old, work that she learned from her parents who always earned a living this way.  Maria works from 7 AM till 4 PM everyday. 

The loan Maura is seeking from CREDICAMPO is for purchase of feed for 150 chickens which she plans to sell in six weeks.  With this loan she will improve her income and be able to give her family a better quality of life.  Maura's dream is to enlarge the chicken farm to help her family and give her three children a better education until they become professionals and thus have more opportunities in life, and to be able to build a better home in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed for 150 chickens which she intends to sell in six weeks

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 55 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married, with six children now at their adult age. 

For her means of living, Nilda has been engaged in a dressmaking business for 22 years already. She earns approximately PHP 4,500 each month doing this type of business activity. 

She has requested a loan to be used to purchase additional cloth, threads, and accessories for her dressmaking business. 

Nilda has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for almost ten years. In the future, Nilda hopes to build her own tailoring business.

loans.use: to purchase additional cloth, threads, and accessories.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en:
Basilia is 29 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with one child who is now school-age. 

Basilia is a plain housewife who takes care of her daughter. She is receiving support from her husband who is a hollow block maker. Her husband is earning approximately PHP10,000 each month doing this type of activity. She has requested a loan to be used to pay the yearly renewal of their MMAP and Philhealth Insurance. Basilia has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Basilia hopes to engage in a business.

loans.use: To be used to pay the yearly renewal of their Philhealth Insurance

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is 62 years old and lives in Lantian, Labangan Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with five children.

Celestina has a sari-sari store that sells different kinds of foods. She had this business for five years. She requested a loan to use as additional capital for her business. She wants to buy more goods for her sari-sari store.

Celestina has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Celestina hopes to become successful and be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more goods for her sari-sari store

location.town: Pagadian Lantian, Labangan, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is from  Bitaug, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor. She is 56-years-old and married with seven kids. 

In 2014, Alicia applied for her membership with PMPC.  Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become one. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Alicia asked for financial assistance of PHP 7,000 to  purchase materials for repair services. Through this, she hopes to increase and have more income and be of help in the expansion of her business.  She has found assistance for their financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to purchase materials for battery assemble

loans.name: Derlinda

texts.en:
Derlinda is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with five children.

To earn a living, Derlinda has a business, selling vegetables. She earns about PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work.

Derlinda has a requested a loan to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell.

Derlinda has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for seven years. In the future, she would like to have her own store.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
WONDERFUL KIVA LENDERS! Meet Moses, 56 years of age, who is a very responsible and hardworking man. He hails from the Kitale area of Kenya, an area with good weather patterns and good soils that favor crop and dairy farming. Moses makes a living through farming and has been doing that for five years. Over those years, he has been able to earn a decent and honest living.
 
Moses loves nature and has even planted trees in his compound so that his farm can be beautiful. He also loves dairy farming and has even nicknamed one of his cow “maridadi” which means beautiful and that is what the cow is to Moses' life. 

Moses is very enterprising and wants to increase the number of dairy cows on his farm. This is because he has enough space and already a market for milk in the Kitale area. Because of these valid reasons, he is kindly requesting a loan of KES 52,000 to be able to buy a dairy cow.

With the dairy cow, Moses is sure of reaping more profits, being able to improve his living conditions and providing a secure future for his children. Moses does not want to be economically empowered alone. That is why he plans to buy more cows and open a dairy shop where he will employ other people to work for him, hence boosting their standards of living.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Socresia

texts.en: Socresia has been running her farm for seven years and she earns well for the needs of her three children and the entire family. Her rice farm has absolutely met the needs for family consumption. Currently, she took a new loan to buy fertilizer. She wants to expand her farm and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, sugar, and potatoes leaves to expand her business.

loans.name: Mukarram

texts.ru: Мукаррам родилась в 1995 году. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Мукаррам не поступила в университет, так как она не имела возможности. Теперь она хочет организовать бизнес скотоводством. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Мукаррам запрашивает займ на сумму 600 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Mukarram was born in 1995. She is not married and lives with her parents. Mukarram did not attend university since she was not able to. Now she wants to start a livestock business. To that end, she studied in the "Bring Success" class organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate. Mukarram is requesting a loan of 600 TJS to buy livestock to establish a new business. She is waiting for your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: buy livestock to start a new business

loans.name: Michael Group

texts.es:
Al grupo solidario Michael lo integran tres socias exitosas en su vida laboral y es coordinado por la señora Carmen una mujer emprendedora de 37 años de edad y soltera, quien ha trabajado con la institución durante dieciocho ciclos, comenzando con el negocio de video juegos en su domicilio, gracias a los préstamos que la institución le ha brindado, ha impulsado un nuevo negocio como es el de una pulpería, lo cual la ha motivado para seguir prestando en la institución y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de arroz, frijoles, aceite, gaseosas, agua purificada, chivería, pan, etc., de modo que este préstamo le permitirá invertir en los productos que la población, mayormente demanda, una de sus metas es ampliar su negocio y llegar a ser propietaria de una miscelánea.
Las otras integrantes son las señoras Jennifer de 24 años de edad, comerciante de accesorios artesanales como es pulseras y chapas, y Zayre de 22 años de edad comerciante de ropa nueva en su domicilio.
texts.en:
This Michael solidarity group  is made up of three members who are successful in their work lives and it is coordinated by Carmen, who is a 37 years old woman and single, who has worked with the institution for 18 cycles. She started a video game business in her home, thanks to the loans from the institution. She is requesting another loan because she wants to open a new grocery store business. The loan will allow her to purchase rice, beans, oil, sodas, purified water, and bread, etc to help diversify the goods in the store and increase the demand from her clients. 

The other group members are Jennifer, who is 24 years old and sells artisan accessories, such as bracelets and metal shoe taps, and Zayre, who is 22 years old and sells new clothing from her home.

loans.use: Para la compra de granos básicos como es arroz, frijoles, aceite, gaseosas, agua purificada, chivería, pan, etc.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Luzviminda, age 51, is married to a carpenter and blessed with five children. She has owned and operated a retail store of personal use products for almost five years and in this business she earns a net income amounting to PHP 1,000 monthly. Due to insufficient funds, she's asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase personal use products to sell such as perfume, talc powder, lotions, body wash, and shampoo to sell in her store. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can display and put all her personal use products in her store.

loans.use: To purchase personal use products to sell such as perfume, talc powder, lotions, body wash, and shampoo to sell in her store.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is married. She is 52-years-old and lives in the Philippines.

Violeta is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. She requested a loan to use as additional capital for hog raising business.

Violeta has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Violeta hopes to earn more and improve their ways of living through her hog raising business.

loans.use: to buy more piglets for her hog raising business

location.town: Pagadian - Navalan, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is widowed with three children. Gina is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Gina is a farmer and grows flowers to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. She requested a loan to use as her additional capital for her flower garden.

Gina has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Gina hopes that she can expand her flower garden and be one of the flower suppliers in the market.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her flower garden

location.town: Pagadian - Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Leila

texts.en: Leila is 31 years old and married. She lives in the small village of Bolnisi district with her two children, husband and pensioner mother-in-law. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land where they grow potatoes. They sell the harvested potatoes at local markets. Leila decided to start her own business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,300 Gel. The loan of 1,300 Gel will help her to purchase merchandise such as groceries and household goods.  Leila is very motivated to have stable income and thinks that the business will be profitable. After the stock is purchased, she will trade in nearby villages and the family will have a stable income, which will enable them to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in future.

loans.use: to begin trading in household goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase underwear and other clothing for resale.

loans.name: Jose Orlando

texts.es:
José un vendedor ambulante que va de un lugar a otro con la esperanza de lograr una venta o de encontrar nuevos clientes se encuentra ante la posibilidad de tener un crédito para la compra de mercancía como ropa y accesorios en acero como aretes, collares, pulseras etc. para distribuirlas por todo el vecindario.

Sueña con poder tener un local comercial para distribuir sus productos y sabe que el local consolidaría mejor su idea de negocio y le atraería más clientes. 

El crédito es muy importante para José no solo porque será la oportunidad de mantenerse en el mercado si no por que le permitirá crecer y aumentar sus ingresos para ayudar a su familia que depende netamente de el
texts.en:
Jose is street seller who goes from place to place hoping to make a sale or to find new customers.  He is taking a loan to buy merchandise such as clothing and steel accessories such as: earrings, necklaces, bracelets, etc., to distribute around his neighborhood.

Jose dreams of having a store where he could sell his products.  He knows that by having a store, he could consolidate his business and attract more customers.

This loan is very important for Jose, not only because it represents an opportunity for him to stay in the market, but also because it will allow him to grow and increase his income so that he can help his family, as they depend solely on him.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru:
Алишер трудолюбивый жизнерадостный мужчина в возрасте 32 лет. Он женат и не имеет пока детей. Он обратился в Арванд впервые, когда узнал, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку.  Сам Алишер  живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Он не имеет высшего образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. И его жена также не имеет высшего образования и является домохозяйкой. Она занимается домашними делами и воспитанием детей. 

Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Алишер занимается своим бизнесом. Он занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. От данного дела он получает хороший доход. Жена Алишера помогает ему в этом деле. Она продаёт на рынке молоко, полученное от скота. Сейчас Алишер хочет увеличить количество скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Алишер очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Alisher is a cheerful, hardworking, 32-year-old man. He is married but does not yet have any children. He turned to Arvand for the first time when he realized that there was an opportunity to receive financial support. Alisher lives with his family in the countryside. He does not have a higher education as he did not have the opportunity to study at university due to financial difficulties in his family. His wife also does not have a higher education. She is a homemaker who does the household chores and will raise their children in the future.

In order to have an income to live on, Alisher runs his own business. He fattens up and resells cattle. He receives a good income from this business. Alisher's wife helps him with this business. She sells the milk, which she gets from the cattle, at the market. Now Alisher wants to increase his number of cattle to expand his business. This is why he turned to Arvand to receive a loan to buy cattle. Alisher really relies on a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Farhana

texts.en: Farhana is a 49-year-old woman and the mother of six children. The man shown in the photo is Farhana’s son who has been running a paint shop for the last 4 years. He has many varieties of paints in his shop. He has been running this business to meet his family’s expenses, but he now requires more funds to cater to more customers. For this reason, Farhana has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR for her son. He wants to buy new buckets of paints in different colors. It will help him to provide better services to his customers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive change to his business.

loans.use: to buy new buckets of paints in different colours.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine has school-going children aged 8 and 16. Her husband is a businessman and Vestine’s business has been of selling food stuffs such as rice, maize flour and cooking oil for the past 2 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice and cooking oil for sale. The profit of the loan will be used to pay school fees for her children. She wishes to expand her business to the extent of being a supplier in the future.

loans.use: to buy more rice and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Donisa

texts.en: Donisa makes a living by managing her own farm where she grows and harvests bananas and other crops. Donisa wants to buy fertiliser in order to restore the nutrients of the farm, which is her main source of income. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the quality of life she wants to provide for the entire family. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase organic fertilizer. In the future, she wants to ensure better living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertiliser.

loans.name: Bibizaynab

texts.ru:
Бибизайнаб трудолюбивая жизнерадостная женщина в возрасте 34 лет. Она замужем и имеет 2-их детей.  Она живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности в небольшом доме. Она не имеет высшего образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье и является домохозяйкой. Она занимается домашними делами и воспитанием детей. 

Чтобы иметь постоянный доход на пропитание,  Бибизайнаб занимается своим любимом делом. Она шьет на заказ женские платья. Муж Бибизайнаб в данное время находится на заработках в России.  Бибизайнаб также занимается дополнительным бизнесом. Она покупает на оптовом базаре детскую одежду и продаёт данный товар на местном рынке. От данного дела она получает хороший доход. Сейчас Бибизайнаб хочет увеличить количество своего товара, чтоб расширить свой бизнес и получать больше прибыли, чтобы кормить своих детей. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку детской одежды для продажи. Бибизайнаб очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Bibizaynab is a cheerful and hardworking 34-year-old woman. She is married and has two children. She lives with her family in the countryside in a small house. She does not have a higher education as she did not have the opportunity to study at university due to financial difficulties in her family. Instead, she became a homemaker. She takes care of the household chores and raises her children.

In order to have a stable income to live on, Bibizaynab does her favorite activity - she takes custom orders for sewing women's dresses. Bibizaynab's husband is currently working abroad in Russia. Bibizaynab also has an additional business. She buys children's clothes at the wholesale bazaar and sells the merchandise at her local market. She makes a good income from these businesses. Now Bibizaynab wants to increase her amount of merchandise so that she can expand her business and make a larger profit in order to feed her children. This is why she turned to Arvand to receive a loan to buy children's clothes for retail sale. Bibizaynab really relies on a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes for retail sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more caustic and palm oil to expand her business

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is a working woman and enjoys doing hand embroidery work. Her handmade designs are very popular in her community. Due to an increase in demand of her designs she needs more funds for her business. She has 4 children. Her husband also supports her work. She is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life including food, clothes and education. She has now requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf foundation. In this way she can manage to buy more frames, needles, sequins, threads and stones which will help in generating more income. She is hopeful that she will have a good experience with this loan.

loans.use: to buy more frames, needles, sequins, threads and stones.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José de 51 años de edad, es agricultor, estudió hasta sexto grado, ya que sus padres eran de muy bajos recursos económicos, no le pudieron proporcionar el estudio mas avanzado, ahora José vive solo con una hermana, ya que no tiene hijos ni esposa, no obstante eso no es una limitante para salir adelante con su trabajo y su vida.

José se ha dedicado a la agricultura toda la vida practicamente, conoce y tiene mucha experiencia en este trabajo,  se levanta a las 5 de la mañana todos los dias, para ir al campo, la distancia que camina es un promedio de un kilometro para llegar hasta el lugar de trabajo y regresa a casa a las 4: 30 de la tarde, su hermana es quien le apoya con la agricultura y quien está pendiente que todo marche bien en el hogar.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar una cama, una cocina y una juguetera, para su hogar.

Las aspiraciones que tiene José son que la cosecha le dé buenos resultados, para obtener las ganancias necesarias para cancelar el préstamo cuando le llegue la fecha de vencimiento,  tener casa propia y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is a 51 year old farmer who only studied through sixth grade, as his parents had very low income and could not afford more advanced study. Today Jose lives with his sister because he does not have children or a wife; however, he does not view this as a constraint to succeed in his work and life. 

José has worked in farming for practically his whole life. He knows the trade well and has a lot of experience in this line of work. He gets up at 5 am every morning to go to the countryside. He walks about one kilometer to reach the work site, and returns home at 4:30 pm. He supports his sister with his job, and she takes care of the home. 

He is requesting a loan from CREDICAMPO to buy a bed, a stove, and shelving for his home. 

José’s aspirations are to have a good harvest so that he can obtain the income to repay the loan on time, to own his own home, and to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a bed, a stove, and shelving for his home.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en: Balqees, a 50-year-old lady, has 7 children. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has been selling vegetables in his locality, with Balqees’ assistance, for 7 years. They use the income to support their entire family. She is in her 8th loan cycle and has shown a good repayment history. She has now requested for an amount of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan amount to buy vegetables including onions, tomatoes and potatoes to create a means of increasing revenue so that she may able to generate healthier source of income. She is thankful to Kashf for the loan and is hopeful that it will help her in increasing her sales and profits.

loans.use: to buy vegetables including onions, tomatoes and potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 30 tanks of butane gas.

loans.name: Kubarahon

texts.ru:
Кубарахон очень добрая и трудолюбивая женщина в возрасте 40 лет. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Она обратилась в Арванд впервые, когда узнала, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку.  Сама Кубарахон  живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Она не имеет высшего образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. Она занимается домашними делами и воспитанием детей. 

Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Кубарахон занимается своим бизнесом. Он шьёт на заказ национальные платья и пастельные принадлежности. От данного дела она получает хороший доход. Муж Кубарахон работает слесарем. Он получает на своей работе не большую зарплату.  Сейчас Кубарахон вместе со своим мужем желают отремонтировать свой дом, в котором живут. Но у них недостаточно собственных средств для покупки всех необходимых строительных материалов для ремонта дома. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов. Кубарахон очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Kubarahon is a very kind and hardworking 40-year-old woman. She is married and has three children. She approached Arvand when she first realized that it is possible to get financial support. Kubarahon lives with her family in the countryside. She does not have a higher education. It was not possible to study at the University because of financial difficulties in the family. She works doing household chores and child-rearing. 

To have enough income to buy food, Kubarahon does business. She sews traditional dresses and bedding sets to order. From this she makes a good income. Kubarahon's husband works as a mechanic. He receives a small salary from his work. Now Kubarahon and her husband want to renovate their home. However, they do not have enough of their own funds to purchase all the necessary building materials for home renovation. Therefore, she went to the Arvand and wants to get a loan to buy building materials. Kubarahon is hoping for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: buy building materials

loans.name: Chashma

texts.ru: Чашма кредитуется первый раз. Она добросовестная и трудолюбивая женщина. Чашма родилась в 1985 году. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 несовершеннолетних детей. Она живет в сельской местности, где люди занимаются животноводством и земледелием. Чашма тоже хочет организовать бизнес скотоводством и таким образом получать доход. С такой целью она участвовала в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 600 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Chashma is taking out a loan for the first time. She is an honest and hardworking woman. Chashma was born in 1985. She is married and has two young children. She lives in the countryside, where people practice livestock breeding and crop farming. Chashma also wants to organize a cattle breeding business and thus, earn an income. With this goal in mind, she participated in the course "Achieve Success," organized by the Association of Businesswomen, and received a certificate. She is requesting a loan for 600 somoni to buy cattle so she can organize her new business. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle to organize her new business.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлюда живет на севере Таджикистана. Она заботливая мать 2 детей. Мавлюда как ответственный родитель всегда старается для благо получения своих детей. Мавлюда планирует организовать свой бизнес скотоводством. Она с такой целью участвовала в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она планирует купить скот, откармливать несколько месяцев и продавать на местном рынке. Ее муж обещал помочь ей введению бизнеса. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 600 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mavluda lives in the north of Tajikistan. She is the attentive mother of two children. As a responsible parent, Mavluda does all that she can in order to provide for her children. Mavluda plans to organize a cattle breeding business. With that goal in mind, she participated in the course "Achieve Success," organized by the Association of Businesswomen and received a certificate. She plans to buy cattle, fatten them up for several months, and then sell them at the local market. Her husband promised to help her with this business. She is requesting a loan for 600 somoni to buy cattle. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle so that she can organize her new business.

loans.name: Ruqiya

texts.en:
Ruqiya is a 47-year-old, married woman and a mother of three children.  She has been successfully running a general store business for the past five years. She offers various goods for daily use. She is in her tenth loan cycle and has shown a good repayment history. 

The loan amount that she has requested is PKR 40,000. Using the loan amount, she wants to grow her business and wants to buy stocks from the market at lower rates, such as oil, rice, spices, biscuits, and beverages. Then she would be able to consistently meet the increasing demand of her customers. She wishes to utilize part of the revenue to deal with the expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks from the market, such as oil, rice, spices, biscuits, and beverages.

loans.name: Navbahor

texts.ru: Навбахор молодая и трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 24 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 1 несовершеннолетнего сына. Навбахор планирует организовать свой бизнес, так как доход ее мужа не достаточно для обеспечения семьи. Навбахор хочет организовать бизнес скотоводством. Она планирует купить мелко-рогатый скот, откармливать несколько месяцев и продавать на местном рынке. Она участвовала в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 600 сомони для покупки мелко-рогатого скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Navbahor is a young and hardworking woman. She is 24. She is married and has a small son. Navbahor plans to begin a business since her husband's income is not enough to support the family. Navbahor wants to organize a livestock business. She plans to buy sheep or goats, fatten them for a few months, and sell them at the local market. She participated in the course "Bring Success" organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate. She is requesting a loan of 600 TJS to buy livestock. She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: buy cattle for starting a new business

loans.name: Philibus Maigemu

texts.en: Philibus Maigemu remembers the starvation his family faced during a particularly bad harvest. This is before he became a Babban Gona member. Now, as a Babban Gona member, Philibus Maigemu, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Philibus Maigemu is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. “In 5 years", Philibus Maigemu expressed, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Astha Maya

texts.en:
Astha Maya is 50 years old. She is married and has 2 children aged 23 and 20. Many years ago, she established her furniture-making business. Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buy woods and timbers for her business. In the future, Astha Maya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In Nepal, furniture is still made the old-fashioned way. Using little more than basic hand tools, skilled artisans form raw lumber into beautifully finished pieces of furniture. With precision and an eye for detail, furniture makers produce shelves, bed frames, and cabinet sets. With the help of a Kiva loan, a furniture maker is able to increase the volume of their lumber purchases or hire additional labor. This additional leverage allows an entrepreneur to increase productivity and profitability.

loans.use: to buy wood and timbers.

loans.name: Honeylyn

texts.en:
Honeylyn runs a fish-selling business. Her husband is a fisherman, and she sells fish in their village. She earns a good income from this, and it sustains their living.  

Honeylyn also operates a general store at home to earn additional income for her family. 

She had a previous loan from GDMPC that she used in purchasing a fishing boat. To improve the business, she took a new loan to purchase fishing nets. She wishes to expand her business and save more for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, iron, cement, sand, and some construction tools

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past year, Maureen has been working hard to manage her small pancake business, which sells pancakes. 

To help expand her business, Maureen has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cassava flour and cooking oil for the business, and will help Maureen to generate greater profits and supplement her siblings’ school fees. Maureen hopes that in the future, she will be able to increase her sales and save some money. 

Maureen is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more cassava flour and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Ankil Devi

texts.en:
Ankil Devi is 65 years old. She is married and has 2 children aged 35 and 28. Many years ago, she established her meat shop business. Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buy goats and chickens. In the future, Ankil Devi plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.
 
In Nepal, the meat is always fresh. In small stalls along busy roads, open air butcher shops sell chicken, goats, and water buffalo by the kilo. The stalls are piled high with product and sales are brisk. With the help of a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase additional stock at better prices. This increase in purchasing volume creates greater profit margins for the borrower.

loans.use: to buy goats and chickens.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou lives in Misamis Occidental. She earns income through selling fish in their village while her husband does fishing to support the needs of her family. She has been doing this for many years. She always wants to augment their situation to provide an improved living standard for her family.

Without hesitation, Marilou borrows an amount to buy new fishing nets. She is a new member of GDMPC, and with her access to it, her goal of improving her business will become easier.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en: Carmela has been involved in a fish vending business. She is 44 years old and married with four children. Her main goal is to increase her sales and income so she is asking for a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy squid, tanigue and anchovies to sell within her local community. She has been in her fish vending business for 15 years. Carmela believes that someday, she will keep her business through continuous access of financial services and hard working.

loans.use: to buy squid, tanigue and anchovies to sell

loans.name: Nillie

texts.en: Nillie is from Misamis Occidental with her family. She has been planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She also raises pigs and she earns additional income from this. Nillie joined GDMPC where she gained access to financial services. This has helped improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Recently, she took a new loan to cover the costs for weeding maintenance. She wants to have a better living in the near future with her family.

loans.use: to cover the costs for weeding maintenance.

loans.name: Junalyn

texts.en: Junalyn has been selling grocery goods in their village and has had this business for many years. This is the primary source of income for the family. With her generated income, she was able to support financially her husband's farming activities. Junalyn took a new loan recently to purchase more grocery goods to sell. Junalyn is planning to expand her farm, hoping it will flourish and enable her to improve her children's lives.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
HELLO KIVA LENDERS! Meet Emmanuel, a very young man, full of energy and a very dedicated farmer who is just 22 years of age. He hails from the Kitale area of Kenya, an area that is very fertile and has good soil. Being very young, he is very ambitious and wants to achieve the best for himself and as he likes to put it, “the sky is the limit for me”. Emmanuel never got any formal employment but this did not kill his morale of succeeding in life. He started farming two years ago and has been making so much progress. Through farming, he has been able to acquire a dairy cow and do crop and poultry farming.

Emmanuel sells milk to his neighbors and the nearby market but his dairy cow has not been fully producing milk. This is because his cow sometimes is sick. Emmanuel does not have a good dairy unit where his cow can rest and hence, his cow is affected by bad weather and falls sick. He spends so much money buying medicine for his cow that he does not have much money to save. That is why he is seeking kindly a KES 40,000 loan to be able to build a dairy unit.

The dairy unit will provide his cow with a good place to rest and a good feeding place for the cow when he is milking the cow. Through this, he is assured of high milk production and spending zero on medicine. Hence, this will help him save more money.

Emmanuel is very optimistic and he is sure that through the loan, he is going to have a secure future. He plans that once he has saved enough money, he will be able to advance his education since education is the “key to success”.

loans.use: To buld a dairy unit

loans.name: Jaime Baltazar

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 22 años de edad vive en el cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolivar su estado civil es casado vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 1 y 2 años de edad.
Es integrante de la ventanilla rural Ambrocio Laso que se dedica a las labores agricolas.
 
Jaime se dedica a la agricultura y siembra de papas, también a la crianza de pollo, utilizara el dinero del crédito para ciclo corto con el apoyo del crédito incrementar el negocio, las compras  realiza en chimbo cada semana.
Su sueño es tener su casa propia, enfrenta los desafíos  que se le presenten en la vida en su tiempo libre se dedica al deporte especialmente al indor.
texts.en:
Jaime, age 22, lives in the San Miguel canton in the Bolivar province.  He is married, and he lives with his wife and their two children, ages one and two.

He is a member of the Ambrocio Laso communal bank, which works in agriculture.  Jaime works in agriculture, and he grows potatoes.  He also raises chickens.

He will use the loan for the short cycle.  With the support of the loan he will expand the business.  He makes his purchases in Chimbo every week.
