Zenaida has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Zenaida would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nini

texts.en:
Nini is a 22-year-old student, who lives in the village of Gvishtibi. Nini has seven members in her family and the significant part of their income is from agricultural activity. Apart from this her grandparents get monthly assistance from the local government. The family cultivates a plot of agricultural land, growing vegetables and using them for local trading. Nini's sister is also a student and they need financial support to get a good education, to progress in life and to increase their family's living condition. Nini requested a loan from MFO Credo and was approved with the amount of 2500 GEL. She decided to purchase five mother pigs, propagate them and sell them for a good price. This loan will be a great support for this hardworking girl, as she will be able to generate significant income and make a better style of life for her family. 

Nini awaits your support and kindness and will be grateful for the help.

loans.use: to purchase five pigs.

loans.name: Nuevos Horizontes Group

texts.es:
ELENA. Lleva el tercer crédito en FODEMI. Dice que es la oportunidad a través de un capital para poder trabajar en su idea de ponerse un comedor hace 3 años, con el que pudo ayudarse por 40 meses. ELENA se enfermó y suspendió esta actividad. Fue cuando cambio de idea y desde ese entonces puso una tienda de abarrotes. Con la cual ha podido crecer como persona.
La casa donde tiene la tienda es propia gracias a los ahorros que ha tenido. Tiene un solo hijo que ya cumplió 15 años que ya está en la secundaria y vive con su hermana quien le administra la tienda.
A ELENA se la presentó la oportunidad de trabajar como profesora en Limones donde pasa toda la semana y regresa a San Lorenzo los viernes en la tarde- para volver los días Lunes.
En este nuevo crédito ELENA  recibirá la cantidad de $1800,00 dólares con los que se abastecerá de productos como: pollo, carne de res, embutidos, pescado aliñado, bebidas refrescantes e hidratantes. Dejando un ahorro para casos de emergencias y pago de las cuotas del crédito.
Ella quiere tener su tienda más grande con toda clase de productos para servir mejor a sus clientes y toda su comunidad.
texts.en:
This is Elena's third loan with the field partner, FODEMI. She says that with the opportunity offered by the first borrowed capital, she was able to open a diner 3 years ago and earn her income for 40 months. Then Elena fell sick and had to suspend her activities. At that point she changed her mind and she opened a grocery store that has allowed her to grow as a person. The house where the store is located belongs to her, thanks to her savings. Elena has a 15-year-old son who attends high school and lives with her sister, who manages the store. An opportunity arose for Elena to work as a teacher in Limones, and she spends the week there, returning to San Lorenzo on Friday afternoons, and then going back to Limones on Mondays.
Elena will get $1800 from this loan, which she will invest in the purchase of chicken, beef, cold cuts, seasoned fish, and beverages. She will also keep some savings for emergencies and to pay the loan fees. Elena wants to expand her store, offering all sorts of products to better serve her customers and the community.

loans.use: to stock on products such chicken, beef, cold cuts, seasoned fish, and beverages. She will also keep some savings in case of an emergency and to pay the loan fees.

loans.name: Gaspar

texts.es:
Soñaba Gaspar, albañil, de 65 años y con tres hijos, dos de ellos casados, tener un negocio propio para llevar la vida más llevadera o tranquila en su lugar de origen, Sololá. Sentía que tenía la habilidad para ventas.  Pero no sabía para qué tipo de negocio él era bueno. 

La vida le dio una oportunidad para trabajar como empleado de una tienda de consumos diarios.  Era lo que él esperaba, no sólo una puerta abierta sino lo que estaba detrás de esa puerta.  Y lo que encontró fue algo que definió lo que él quería ser.

Al pasar el tiempo, con esmero y sacrificio, logró contar con un negocio propio de consumos diarios en su lugar de origen, Sololá.  El mismo oficio que aprendió cuando fue empleado.

Ahora su tercer hijo, que tiene 22 años, le ayuda en su negocio propio.  Mientras Gaspar también se desenvuelve como una segunda actividad a su otro oficio de albañil.

Gaspar solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción para continuar sus sueños de albañil y vendedor de productos de consumo diario.
texts.en:
Gaspar, age 65, bricklayer and father of three children, two of whom are married, always dreamed of having his own business. He believed it would help him lead a calmer, more manageable life in his home of Sololá. He always felt like he had a knack for sales, but he never knew what sort of business he would be good at.

Life gave him an opportunity to work as an employee at a store selling common household items. It was everything he expected - not just an open door, but one he could walk through. And what he found defined what he wanted to become. Over time, with hard work and sacrifice, he managed to get his own household staples store in Sololá, doing the very same work that he had learned as an employee.

And now his youngest child, who is 22 years old, is helping him run the business. Gaspar, in the mean time, has taken up secondary work as a bricklayer. Gaspar is requesting this loan so that he can buy construction materials and continue to fulfill his dreams as both a bricklayer and a seller of household staples.

loans.use: buy construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand garden and pay for farm inputs like good quality seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To cultivate new garden and buy farm inputs like good quality seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To pay for farm inputs like good quality seeds, fertilizers, herbicides and pestcides to improve their farming

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To pay for farm inputs like good quality seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To cultivate new gardens and buy good quality seeds, fertilizers and farm tools

loans.name: Barau

texts.en: Barau is a 28-year-old farmer from Kyasge.  As a Babban Gona member, Barau is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Barau can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Barau is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 35 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Barau is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children; Hadiza,  and  A'I. Barau’s dreams do not end there: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Soknum's Group

texts.en: Soknum’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Soknum makes a living trading fruits and working as a farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Puthea's Group

texts.en: Puthea’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Puthea makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Balmore

texts.es: Balmore de 37 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus 3 hijos de 18, 16 y 5 años de edad. Él es un hombre muy trabajador que desde hace 6 años se dedica a la jardinería en una residencial  cercana a su localidad. De esta forma logra mantener la economía del hogar. Balmore desea terminar el muro perimetral de su vivienda ya que por falta de recursos económicos no ha podido terminar, además desea cambiar el techo del patio de su vivienda que se encuentra deteriorado por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, lámina galvanizada y madera para hacer las mejoras necesarias a su vivienda.
texts.en: Balmore, 37, lives with his spouse and their 3 children, aged 18, 16, and 5. He is a hard working man who has worked as a gardener in a residential area close to his city for 6 years. That is how he pays for the household expenses. Balmore wants to finish the perimeter wall of his house, that he hasn't been able to finish due to lack of funds. He also wants to change the roof of his home porch, which has become deteriorated. He is asking for a loan from our field partner, FUSAI, to purchase cement, sand, gravel, bricks, galvanized metal sheets and wood to make the necessary improvements to his home.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, galvanized metal sheets and wood to fix the roof and cement the floor of his home.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosemarie is 32 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Rosemarie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Rosemarie requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Rosemarie has been in this business for five years. In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Nelfa is 34 years old and married with three children. With three children currently in school, Nelfa works very hard to provide for them.

Nelfa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like detergent soap, shampoo, cooking oil, biscuits, noodles and other groceries to sell.

Nelfa has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, shampoo, cooking oil, biscuits, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Nelfa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like detergent soap, shampoo, cooking oil, biscuits, noodles and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nonita

texts.en:
Nonita is 49 years old and a married woman with twelve children, six of whom are currently in school. For the past 10 years, she has run a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Nonita is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en: Khadija operates a food-selling business, selling to her neighbors. With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase rice, beans, vegetables, maize flour and wheat flour for the business. She appreciates the support from Yehu and Kiva at large.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, vegetables, maize flour and wheat flour for her business.

loans.name: Asmat

texts.en: Asmat is 45-year-old married woman from a small village in the Khobi district, West Georgia. She lives with her husband and 2 children. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have cows and produce cheese to sell. In addition they have a plot of land, where they grow nut trees. Asmat sells the harvested nuts locally. She decided to expand her agricultural activities and requested a loan. The Start Up Program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 800 Gel. With the received credit she will purchase and raise a pig. Asmat will expand her livestock in the future. This will give her a chance to increase the income of her family. Asmat awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a pig

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more general stock and stationary for resale.

loans.name: Cesar Armando

texts.es: Cesar de 20 años de edad vive con su madre y sus 5 hermanos de 18,16,15, 12 y 5 años de edad. Él es un joven trabajador que desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras de forma ambulante en el mercado central de su municipio. Cesar es un joven responsable que anteriormente tuvo crédito con FUSAI con el cual construyo el muro perimetral de su vivienda, actualmente desea encementar el piso de la misma por lo que solicita a FUSAI un nuevo crédito para comprar: arena, cemento y grava, además deberá pagar mano de obra para encementar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en: Cesar, age 20, lives with his mother and his five siblings, aged 18, 16, 15, 12 and 5 years. He's a hard worker who has five years of experience selling fruits and vegetables traveling around the central market in his city. Cesar is a responsible young man who has taken out a previous loan from FUSAI, which he used to build a perimeter all around their home. He currently wants to add a cement floor to the home, which is why he has come to FUSAI for a new loan. It will be used to buy sand, cement, and gravel, and additionally to pay for the manual labor that he needs.

loans.use: renovate his home to add cement floors

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 37 years old. She is married to Samuel and they have been blessed with five children. Eunice runs a food stall where she sells food and retail products, especially household goods. She has run her business for the past three years and earns a monthly income of 8,000 KES. Her husband, Samuel, provides transport using his motorcycle which provides additional income for their family.

Eunice is requesting a 10,000 KES loan through VisionFund Kenya to buy sugar, rice and wheat flour to sell. She will use the anticipated profit from her loan to educate her children. Eunice hopes and dreams that she will be able to educate her children to high levels in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice and wheat flour to sell

loans.name: Angel Antonio

texts.es:
El señor  Ángel  de  45  años de edad  es  casado y vive con su esposa en su casa de habitación, se dedica  al transporte cuenta con dos motos taxi en el cual transporta persona diariamente de su aldea, es una persona muy luchadora y vive en una aldea al sur de honduras. 
Don Ángel solicita el préstamo para reparar una  de sus moto taxis el cual se fundió el motor, con el apoyo de este crédito espera reparar su otra unidad y tener mejores ingresos.
Su sueño es  comprarse una nueva moto taxi.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2014
texts.en:
Ángel is 45 years old, married and lives with his wife in their home.  He works in transportation, and has two moto taxis which he uses to transport people daily in his town.  He is a hardworking man who lives in a town in southern Honduras.

Ángel is seeking a loan to repair one of his moto taxis whose engine failed.  With the help of this loan, he hopes to repair his moto taxi and improve his earnings.  His dream is to purchase a new moto taxi.

San Lorenzo, Honduras- July, 2014

loans.use: purchase an engine for his business.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
El  señor José de 56 años de edad es casado vive con sus esposa y una hija en su casa de habitación donde cuenta con una pulpería, en la misma vende lo que es  todo en  abarrotería y refrescos,  es conocido por ser una persona muy luchadora y con el deseo de seguir adelante. 
Don José vive en una  aldea al sur de Honduras, está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de agua, refrescos, café, azúcar, arroz, aceite, pan, huevos, queso, etc. para tener más producto que ofrecerles a los clientes que lo visitan,  con las ganancias espera mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Don José su sueño es tener sus negocios más surtidos y obtener más ganancias.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2014
texts.en:
José, age 56, lives in a village in southern Honduras with his wife and daughter.  In his home, he also runs a small corner store, where he sells all kinds of groceries and refreshments. He is known for being a hard working person with a strong desire to get ahead. He is requesting this loan to buy water, sodas, coffee, sugar, rice, oil, bread, eggs, cheese, and more so that he has what his customers are looking for when they stop by. With his earnings, he hopes to improve his and his family's quality of life a bit. José's dream is to run a better stocked grocery store and make more money.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - July, 2014

loans.use: stock his small grocery store

loans.name: Nemelyn

texts.en:
Nemelyn is 28 years old and married with two children.

Nemelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Nemelyn has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Nemelyn aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara works hard to support her family. Clara is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Clara is requesting a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional box of fish to sell in her fish stall. She has been in this business for 10 years. Clara would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional box of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma thanks both Yehu and Kiva for the support.  She comes to you again requesting another loan of 40,000 KES to purchase rice, bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for the business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for the business

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is 35 years old and is married with five children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past 10 years, she has operated a rug-making business in the Philippines. Analie is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Analie is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more materials such as fabric for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials to make rugs

loans.name: Elkin Fernando

texts.es:
A sus 35 años de edad el señor Elkin es el orgullo dueño de un terreno de campo en el cual comenzó con la cría de ganado pues se ha dedicado toda la vida al campo gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres quienes lo instruyeron y lo entrenaron en el tema.

Su negocio se ve afectado por los cambios climáticos que vivimos hoy en día y pasa por una dura temporada de sequía, y debido a que vive en una zona de difícil acceso le es difícil encontrar entidades que le faciliten dinero para apoyar su negocio en épocas difíciles.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de reces y cuido con los que apoyara sus animales en épocas difíciles teniéndoles una buena alimentación para dichas temporadas. 
Este crédito es de gran importancia porque de el depende la continuidad de su negocio y estilo de vida campesino
texts.en:
At 35 years old, Elkin is a proud owner of a plot of land on which he started to raise cattle since he has dedicated his whole life to farming thanks to the teachings of his parents who taught him and trained him in this field.  His business has been affected by the changes in climates that are occurring, as they are going through a difficult drought.  On top of this, he lives in a region that is difficult to access, and it is hard for him to find entities that will lend him money to support his business during these hard times.

He is seeking a loan to purchase cattle and provide his animals with care during these difficult times by providing them with good feed.  This loan is very important because the continuity of his business and his life as a farmer depend on it.

loans.use: purchase cattle and care for them.

loans.name: Mzisana

texts.en:
Mzisana is 53 years old. She lives with her husband, son and his family in the small village in Martvili district.

The only source of income for the family is her son's small monthly salary working as a hired worker. Mzisana decided to start a husbandry business and she gathered some money, but she needs a small amount to add. The Start up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 250 GEL. She will be able to purchase a cow and start producing dairy products. Mzisana will be involved in her husbandry business and she plans to expand this activity in future. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Meri

texts.en:
This is Meri's second loan on Kiva's website. She still works hard, on a family-owned vineyard and as a waiter at the local restaurant, to earn her family's living. Meri also generates income by selling grapes at a good price. However, her income isn't enough to make a good style of life for her son's family. She requested a loan and was approved within the start-up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. Meri plans to purchase stocks of blankets, mattresses and coverlets, and start trading locally. She decided to purchase these products in Turkey, where the biggest market is located and she can purchase at wholesale prices. 

The new business initiative will give Meri a chance to have financial stability and increase her monthly income. Meri relies on your good will and awaits your support.

loans.use: to start a trading business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pots to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect her home to Haiti's first solar hybrid, smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Avanzamos Con Fe Group

texts.es:
Cacagual es una comunidad del Cantón Eloy Alfaro donde llegamos y pudimos encontrar a ANABEL. Ella tiene 29 años vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos varones de 9 y 3 años. El mayor de ellos ya asiste a la escuela y el menor aun no porque en esta comunidad no se cuenta con educación inicial.
Su esposo trabaja en Limones en una institución de protección al medio ambiente y el eco sistema.
ANABEL es maestra contratada en una escuela del pueblo por el momento ha dejado de estudiar la Universidad debido a que en su trabajo no le dan el permiso de poder asistir a clases. Tenía previsto criar pollos. 
Ha cambiado de idea y sembrará coco para comercializarlo en Borbón y Guayaquil. Es un buen negocio y aprovecharía las tierras de la familia donde no hay cultivo. 
Con este préstamo comprará la semilla de coco para proceder a la siembra ya que la temporada es ideal para empezar.
Al cabo de 3 años. Espera convertirse en una micro empresaria de este producto teniendo una bodega de almacenamiento y comprar este producto a los vecinos.
Cabe indicar que desde las fábricas de aceites, jabones y otros productos buscan coco en esta zona y es muy rentable.
texts.en:
Cacagual is a community in the Eloy Alfaro canton; that's where we came and met Anabel. She's 29 years old and is living with her husband and their two boys, aged 9 and 3. The older boy attends school, but the other one doesn't yet because the community doesn't have preschool options. Her husband works in Limones for an institution that protects the environment and ecosystem.

Anabel herself is a teacher hired by a school in the village. For the time being, she has her university studies on hold since her work doesn't allow her to be able to attend classes. She had previously expected to raise chickens, but she changed her mind and will plant coconuts, which she will later sell in Borbón y Guayaquil. It's a good business, and she will be able to take advantage of family land where nothing is currently growing. 

With this loan, she will buy coconut seed so that she can plant it, since this is just the right season. Within three years, she hopes to have become a small business owner with her own shop, selling her produce to neighbors. Factories that make oil, soaps, and other products from coconut often seek it out in this area, making it very profitable.

loans.use: buy and prepare coconut seed for the planting season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect her home to Haiti's first solar hybrid, smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect her home to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Roberth Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Roberth es un agricultor muy habilidoso con experiencia en varias áreas de la agricultura, con un talento innato para el trabajo en equipo y una gran mente emprendedora.

Tiene un gran cultivo de yuca y plátano que atiende todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana. Actualmente vive con su esposa y su hija de 4 años por las cuales ha tratado de luchar siempre para sacarlas adelante.

El desea darle un impulso a su cultivo y obtener mejores ingresos de este por eso pide un auxilio económico para invertirlo en insumos agropecuarios y semillas de yuca, el préstamo le dará la oportunidad de tener un producto de mejor calidad.

Su mayor sueño es tener una casa propia y brindarle a su hija un buen futuro.
texts.en:
Roberth is a a very skilled farmer with experience in a variety of agricultural areas.  He has an innate talent for teamwork and a great entrepreneurial mind.  He has a large yucca and plantain plantation that he tends to everyday from very early in the mornings.  He currently lives with his wife and his four year old daughter for whom he has always tried to fight for to get them ahead.  

He hopes to boost his crops and generate greater earnings from them, which is why he is seeking financial help to purchase agricultural supplies and yucca seeds. The loan will give him the opportunity to have a better quality product.  His greatest dream is to have his own house and to give his daughter a better future.

loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Ramla

texts.en:
Ramla is married with 4 children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a food selling business, selling in a cafe to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a big hotel business in the near future. 

With the 50,000 KES she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Melquisedec

texts.es:
Melquicedec es un agricultor de nacimiento y empresario muy habilidoso, criado con grandes valores y fortalezas.

Melquicedec, al notar que los ingresos que obtenía como agricultor no eran suficientes para sostener a su familia, decidió montar un negocio de hospedaje y restaurante en el municipio de Tierra Alta.

Inicio con este negocio buscando nuevas oportunidades para progresar y salir adelante junto con su familia. Hasta ahora ha tenido ciertas dificultades de salud que le han estancado en su negocio, pero tiene gran coraje para mantenerse en pie y seguir luchando.
Solicita un préstamo para la adecuación de su pequeño hotel y realizar algunas reformas a este, adicionalmente desea comprar insumos para la parte de su restaurante.

Con este créditos estas apoyando a un hombre emprendedor, pujante y gran padre de familia que siempre quiere lo mejor para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Melquicedec was born a farmer and is a very capable businessman, raised with strong values.  He noticed that his income as a farmer wasn't enough to support his family, so he decided to open a guesthouse and restaurant in the city of Tierra Alta. He started the business seeking new ways to make progress along with his family. Until now, he's had some health troubles that have hindered him in his business, but he has great strength of heart to keep standing and keep fighting. He is requesting this loan so that he can renovate his small hotel and makes some improvements to it. He also wants to buy supplies for part of his restaurant.

By making this loan, you are supporting a thriving entrepreneur and a wonderful father who always wants the best for his children.

loans.use: remodel his hotel and supply his restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect her home and business to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect her home to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect her home to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos de 54 años de edad es conocido como una persona responsable y muy  trabajador, desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de maíz, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarlos por los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, Santos vive en casa propia con su esposa y  sus cuatro hijos los dos mayores ya trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, con sus ventas logra salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, Santos solicita un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y así poder continuar con sus cultivos y poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Santos, age 54, is known as a responsible and hard-working person. For several years now, he's been in the business of growing corn. When his harvest is ready, he stores it in grain silos, as shown in the picture, for later sale throughout the markets close to his home.  Santos lives in his own house along with his wife and their four children, two of whom are grown up, working and helping to support the family. With his sales, he is managing to make ends meet. Santos is requesting this loan so that he can buy seed, fertilizer, manure, fungicides, herbicides, etc. This will enable him to continue planting his crops and providing his family with greater economic stability.

loans.use: purchase farming supplies, such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome, 23 years old, is from the city of  Batumi. She lives with her husband and two little daughters. The family earns their living mainly through Salome's husband's work as  a private artisan, which generates 400 GEL monthly. Since this income isn't enough to meet all daily expenses, Salome decided to do her bit for the family's welfare and start her own activity. She couldn’t receive a loan from local financial institutions because of their requirements to have business experience or stable revenue. Salome came to the Start Up program, a joint product of Kiva and Credo, which allows people to get a chance for starting or re-starting a business. 

Salome plans to purchase clothing stock at wholesale prices from Turkey, open a mini-store at the local market and start selling. She is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to ensure her children get a good education for progressing in life. This credit will be a great support for the family. Salome is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving her a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to purchase clothing stock and to open a mini-store at the local market

loans.name: Anna Lee

texts.en: Anna Lee is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 3 years, she has had a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Anna Lee has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell to her customers. In the future, Anna Lee would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali is a 46-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and son in a small village in the Zugdidi district. Lali and her husband are unemployed and do not have any source of income. All members of the family are provided with a pension from government institutions as they live in poverty. 

Lali decided to start a husbandry business and requested a loan. The Start up program, a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,000 GEL. Lali will use the loan to purchase sheep and she will expand her husbandry business in the future. Lali will start producing cheese and sell it locally. This will give her a chance to earn an income and improve living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect her home to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect his home to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Maqsooda

texts.en:
Maqsooda is a 50-year-old married woman. She has had a business doing hand embroidery for the past five years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong, but business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is employed as a sales person in a grocery store, but he does not earn enough to support his family well. Maqsooda's embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. She is a mother of four children.

Maqsooda wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. She shared her dream of running a training center for the girls of her village. Maqsooda is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect her home to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect her home to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect her home to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect his home to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect his home to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en: Emelia is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 30 years, she has had a business buying and selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines. Emelia has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell. Emelia would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Jonnathan Steven

texts.es:
Jonnathan es un joven muy emprendedor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar.

Desde hace 3 años se viene dedicando a la venta de mercancía como ropa, accesorios y elementos para el hogar, estos productos los vende de forma ambulante y ya tiene algunos clientes establecidos.

Desde muy niño sintió gran afinidad con el comercio y las ventas, por lo que hoy en día tiene grandes habilidades en este campo gracias a su simpatía y excelente calidad de servicio.

Solicita un préstamo para comprar surtido de mercancía al por mayor que le permita aumentar sus inventarios y generar unos mejores ingresos con los cuales podrá ayudar a solventar los gastos de su hogar y colaborar a sus padres.

Tiene la esperanza de poder salir adelante gracias al apoyo de las personas de buen corazón que apoyan este tipo de proyectos.
texts.en:
Jonnathan is a young entrepreneur who is very eager to grow and move forward. He has been selling merchandise such as clothing, accessories, and household items for three years. He sells these products on foot, and he already has established customers. He has had a great affinity for commerce and sales since he was very young; and today he is very skilled in this field, thanks to his friendliness and the excellent quality of his service. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase an assortment of wholesale merchandise that will enable him to increase his inventory and generate better income.  With it, he will be able to help pay his household expenses and assist his parents.

loans.use: to stock his business.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa, 42 years old, is married and has three children, all currently in school. Elsa works very hard to provide for them. For the past 9 years, Elsa has run a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as cereals, coffee, detergent, soap, shampoo, chocolate drinks, sanitary pads, noodles, etc. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more of these items. In the future, Elsa would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items, such as cereals, coffee, detergent, soap, shampoo, chocolate drinks, sanitary pads, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es:
Cruz es una señora que vive en una aldea llamada Chuaxic, Sololá.  Tiene 41 años y vive en unión con su esposo.  Tiene tres hijos con edad de 22, 20 y 18 años quienes son agricultores. También tiene tres hijas con edades de 14, 12 y 8 años.

Cruz se ha dedicado a la agricultura en el lugar de su domicilio desde hace más de 20 años para poder salir adelante y así sostener a su familia.  Además  Cruz se dedica al tejido típico y tradicional de su lugar.

La señora Cruz está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de semilla de papa.

Su mayor deseo es poder producir más de lo que ya produce a través de la agricultura comprando más cuerdas de tierra.
texts.en:
Señora Cruz is 41 and lives with her husband in the town of Chuaxic, in the Department of Sololá. The couple has six children; three sons ages 22, 20, and 18, who are all farmers; and three daughters, ages 14, 12, and 8.  Señora Cruz has a farmed a plot next to her home for over 20 years so that she can improve her situation and support her family. She also makes traditional regional textiles. 

Señora Cruz is applying for a loan to purchase seed potatoes. Her top priority is to be able to improve her harvest, as that would allow her to purchase additional plots of land.

loans.use: to purchase seed potatoes.

loans.name: Los Aguacatales Group

texts.es: Mario Alfonso tiene 43 años de edad (en la foto aparece de tercero, viste traje típico de color celeste) vive en Sololá, departamento de Sololá, él solicita nuevamente crédito para el mantenimiento de maíz, antes de tener crédito en ADICLA, le era imposible cumplir  sus metas porque no le alcanzaba el capital, Mario Alfonso necesita nuevamente crédito para comprar insumos (abono orgánico) para el mantenimiento de maíz, con el crédito Mario Alfonso garantiza la cosecha, además tendrán alimentación de la familia para todo el año, la meta de Mario Alfonso es construir dos cuartos para que vivan sus hijos en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Mario Alfonso is 43 years old (he appears third from left in the photo, wearing light blue traditional clothing). He lives in Sololá, in the Sololá district.  He is requesting a new loan to maintain his corn crops. Before having a loan from ADICLA, it was impossible to reach his goals because he did not have enough money.  

Mario Alfonso is requesting a new loan to buy supplies (organic fertilizer) for the upkeep of his corn crop. With the loan Mario Alfonso is ensuring the harvest, and in addition will have food for his family for the entire year.  Mario Alfonso's goal is to build two rooms in order for his children to live in better conditions.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect her home to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect his home to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es:
Don Alcides es un señor de 61 años, padre de familia, originario del municipio de El Sauce un poblado ubicado al occidente de León.
Desde hace más de diez años se dedica a laborar como jardinero para una Institución en el mismo municipio.
Profesión que le gusta ejercer con empeño y amor porque es lo que le ha gustado realizar toda su vida darle mantenimiento y vida a las plantas para que embellezcan cualquier lugar.
Don Alcides es un padre responsable que ha tratado de darle lo mejor a sus hijos en educación y condiciones en su hogar.
Gracias a los préstamos que le ha otorgado Kiva a través de Ceprodel le ha ayudado a su esposa en su negocio la cual es sastre, ha mejorado su vivienda y ha resuelto problemas de salud.
En este momento don Alcides tiene la necesidad de un crédito para compra de medicamentos con el fin de mejorar su salud y rendir en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Alcides is a gentleman of some 61 years of age, a family man, originally from the town of El Sauce, a village located west of León. For more than ten years, he has worked as a gardener at an institution in the same city. He does his work with love and dedication because all his life, he has enjoyed providing and caring for plants, which bring beauty to any place.

Alcides is a responsible father who has tried to provide his childen with the best education and living conditions. Thanks to Kiva lenders and Ceprodel, his wife has received help in her business as a tailor, he has improved his home, and he has resolved certain health issues. At this time, Alcides needs a loan to buy the medication he needs to improve his health and perform his job well.

loans.use: buy medicine

loans.name: Mwari

texts.en:
Mwari operates a tailoring business and she is doing well with it. She makes women's suits and men's suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a tailoring school in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business and she appreciates the support for the previous loan.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda, 58 years old, is married and has three children. She works very hard to provide for them. For the past 6 years, Erlinda has run a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, snack foods, noodles, cooking oil, candies, etc. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more of these items to sell. In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as canned goods, soft drinks, snack foods, noodles, cooking oil, candies, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 45-year-old divorcee and the mother of 3 children, all attending different schools. She has been a farmer since 2004 because farming required less capital and it was her area of expertise. Jane grows matooke (cooking banana) and coffee for sale and home consumption. She works 6 days a week and 8 hours per day. She normally sells her products to traders from Kampala and neighboring trading centers. Jane also owns a retail business in a trading center to gain additional income to support her family. 

Jane hopes to use this loan to buy fertilizers and pesticide for her banana plantations. Her hope and dream is to expand her business so that she can be able to yield bananas in larger quantities. However, she faces challenges of lack of enough capital and price fluctuations, which affect her output and profits. Jane is described as an honest and hardworking woman in business.

loans.use: to buy organic manure and pesticides

loans.name: Natela

texts.en: Natela is 63 years old. She lives with her husband in Gori district. Natela and her husband are provided with a retirement pension. They have no other source of income and thus Natela decide to start her own business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 500 Gel to purchase patterns. She will get orders and will sew bed linens. She is experienced in this field and thinks that the business will be profitable, since she will offer good prices to her clients. That's why she thinks she will have satisfied clients. Natela awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase patterns and sew bed linens.

loans.name: Vii

texts.en:
Vii is married and blessed with five children. For the last 34 years, he has run a butchery, earning a monthly income of KES 28,000. Vii has requested a KES 30,000 loan to buy a cow and a goat. He will use the profits to educate his children and improve their living standards.

This is Vii's second loan with VisionFund Kenya, after successfully paying back his previous loan. His hope and dream is to have a stable farmyard for tomatoes.

loans.use: to buy a cow and a goat for slaughter

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: Rosa de 51 años de edad se dedica desde hace 5 años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada, tiene clientela establecida que la prefieren por la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender y las tortillas siempre están calientitas, Rosa vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar maíz por mayor y cal, ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi seguirle dando a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin ninguna limitación.
texts.en: Rosa is 51 years old, and has worked for 5 years making and selling tortillas.  Her business is located in her home, in a busy neighborhood.  She has an established customer base of people who prefer her because of her kindness.  Her tortillas are always warm when she sells them.  Rosa lives in her own home with her family.  She is requesting a loan to be able to buy wholesale corn and lime, because this is her only source of work, and in this way she can continue providing her family with a better quality of life without limits.

loans.use: to buy wholesale corn and lime.

loans.name: Esha

texts.en: Esha operates a business selling fresh water. Her major challenge is seasonality, especially during the rainy season, when business is low. Esha want to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase a water tank and install a water tap for her business. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future out of the profits.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank and install a water tap for her business

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 47 years old and married with seven children. With two children currently in school, Liza works very hard to provide for them.

Liza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like feeds, rice, canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, etc., to sell.

Liza has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as feeds, rice, canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. 

In the future, Liza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like feeds, rice, canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy works hard to support her family. Lucy is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Lucy requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like fishing nets, fish containers, etc., for her business.

Lucy has been in this business for 35 years now.

In the future, Lucy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fishing nets, fish containers, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more power juice, biscuits and chocolate for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, cassava and general stock for resale.

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es:
El señor Juan Ramón  de 70 años de edad es casado,  no tiene hijos que dependen de él,  vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras,  tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 05  años  a la venta de bolsa plástica de todas las medidas.
Don Juan Ramón sus clientes son personas que tienen negocio en el mercado nuevo y viejo de San Lorenzo, también entrega bolsas grandes a las dos ferreterías que quedan cerca de su comunidad, es un señor trabajador que pese a su edad es una persona emprendedora que desea salir adelante.
Don Juan Ramón está solicitando el préstamo para comprar bolsas grandes, medianas y pequeñas porque viene la época de la feria en donde el vende bastante debido a que vienen otros comerciantes que también necesitan de estos productos. Es su segundo crédito que solicita. 
Su sueño es mejorar su casa y su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2014.
texts.en: Juan Ramon is 70 years old and is married.  He has no dependent children.  He lives in the community of San Lorenzo, in a valley in the south of Honduras.  He owns his home, and has worked for 5 years selling plastic bags of different sizes.  Juan Ramon's customers are people who have businesses in the new and old markets of San Lorenzo.  He also provides large bags to the two hardware stores that are close to his community.  He is a hard-working man who, in spite of his age, is enterprising and wants to get ahead.  Juan Ramon is requesting a loan to buy large, medium and small bags, because the market season is coming, and he sells a lot at this time because other businesses need his products.  This is the second loan that he has requested.  His dream is to improve his house and his business.  San Lorenzo, Honduras - July 2014

loans.use: to buy large, medium and small bags for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 26 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su familia, desde hace 4 años ella decidió poner una pequeña  tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia para poder ayudar a su familia en los gastos del hogar, tiene mucha clientela por los buenos precios, la clienta está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más mercadería como: sopas, azúcar, maíz, frijoles, golosinas, refrescos, arroz, etc. Todo por mayor y poder surtir aun mas su negocio y así obtener mejores ingresos para seguir ayudando a su familia sin ninguna limitación.
texts.en: The client is 26 years old and lives in her own house with her family. Four years ago she decided to open a small store located in her place of residence to help her family with the household expenses. She has lots of clients because of her good prices. The client is requesting a loan to be able to buy more merchandise like soups, sugar, corn, beans, sweets, soft drinks, rice, etc. She will buy it all wholesale and stock her store more. Then she can have greater revenues to continue helping her family unconditionally.

loans.use: to buy soups, sugar, corn, beans, sweets, soft drinks, rice, etc.

loans.name: Flordeliz

texts.en: Flordeliz, 36 years old, is married and has two children, both in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 8 years, Flordeliz has had a business selling school uniforms in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of school uniforms to sell to her customers. In the future, Flordeliz would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of school uniforms to sell

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Sally is 32 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Sally has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Sally requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for her fishing business.

Sally has been in this business for five years. In the future, Sally would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en: Jessie, 39 years old, is married and has nine children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 8 years, Jessie has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from rug making. Jessie has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store. Jessie aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 56 years old and married with five children. With one child still in school, Wilma works very hard to provide for them.

Wilma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries like diapers, sanitary pads, toothpaste, bath soap, noodles, etc., to sell.

Wilma has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as diapers, sanitary pads, toothpaste, bath soap, noodles, etc. 

Wilma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries like diapers, sanitary pads, toothpaste, bath soap, noodles, etc., to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is an 18-year-old married woman who lives in the Kutaisi area of Georgia with her husband. She is unemployed and he works at local lemonade factory where he earns a small monthly income. Mariam wants to start her own business, but she has no experience. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo that allows people like her to get a loan to start a business. With the loan she is requesting, Mariam will buy clothing in Turkey at wholesale prices and then resell it in Kutaisi at higher prices. This will give her a chance to be involved in her own business and increase the income of her family. Mariam thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to begin selling clothing.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en: Laura is a hardworking entrepreneur who has had a business selling dry goods in the Philippines for 20 years. She earns additional income from a general store. Laura is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of dry goods such as slippers, blankets, blouses, etc. to sell. Laura has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of dry goods such as slippers, blankets, blouses, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pots to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, fish and cooking seasoning to prepare her cookery business.

loans.name: Ledesma

texts.en: Ledesma is 55 years old, married and the mother of five children. With two children currently in school, she works very hard by running a general store in the Philippines. She is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan from NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. Ledesma has been in business for six years and sells a variety of items such as eggs, shampoo, detergent, soap, canned goods, soft drinks, seasonings, and more. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es: Wilson, tiene 25 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene 3 hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio de Morazán, Yoro. Hace 10 años que tiene su propio cultivo de maíz el cual es su fuente de ingresos, la producción la vende en la misma zona. Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo por 7,000 lempiras para comprar insumos como abonos y pago de mano de obra para darle buen mantenimiento al cultivo de maíz. Su propósito es sacar la producción de mejor calidad para ofrecer al mercado. Su plan es tener siempre su fuente de ingresos y darles estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en: Wilson is 25 years old and lives with his partner, with whom he has 3 children.  They live in a village in the municipality of Morazán, Yoro.  For 10 years he has had his own corn crop, which is his source of income.  He sells his product locally.  He is requesting a second loan, of 7,000 lempiras, to buy supplies such as fertilizer and to pay for labor to main his corn crop well.  His goal is produce the best quality product to offer in the market.  His plan is to have a source of income always, and to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to maintain his corn crop.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en: Martina, 30 years old, is married to Antony, and they have been blessed with 3 children. Antony, a driver, provides additional income for the family. For the past 3 years, Martina has been in the transport business. She has requested her second loan of KES 45,000 with VisionFund Kenya to purchase vehicle tires. She has successfully repaid her previous loan. Martina will be able to educate her children with the anticipated profits. Martina's hope and dream for the future is to be able to educate all her children.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle tires

loans.name: Biasha

texts.en:
Biasha is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Biasha has operated a food-selling business, making dumplings and flat bread for sale. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more palm oil, onions and seasoning to resell.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is married and works hard to support her family. She has had a general store business in the Philippines for six years.

Leonora has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Macrina

texts.en: Macrina is 47 years old, married and works very hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 35,000 from NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as snacks, biscuits, vinegar, canned goods, beer, milk, coffee, and other items. Macrina has been in business for eight years and sells a variety of items. Her goal for the future is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Simeon

texts.en:
Simeon is 55 years old and married to Juliana who adds additional income to support their family. He is blessed with four children. Simeon operates a grocery business, which has been in operation for 10 years. He earns an income of KES 8,000 at the end of every month.
 
Simeon was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing his first loan of KES 10,000. He and intends to use this loan to buy potatoes, tomatoes, cabbages and kale to sell to his customers.

Simeon plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for his children. He hopes to have a bright future with a lot of success and provide the best quality education to his children.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, tomatoes, cabbage, and kale to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, aged 62, is a hard-working widow who is taking care of one child. She has been operating a grocery stall for 10 years earning an income of KES 8,000 at the end of every month.

Jane is now servicing her sixth loan of KES 20,000 with VisionFund Kenya. She intends to use the entire amount to buy some additional fruits: watermelons, passionfruit, oranges and avocados to sell to her customers.

Jane plans to use the anticipated income to educate her child and hopes to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy watermelons, passionfruit, oranges and avocados to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino, a 29-year-old married woman, lives in the Zugdidi district. She has a mother and a husband, who get assistance. Nino is a teacher and she has had private pupils for 4 years, generating a small income. Nino lacks access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business, as they require stable income and business experience. 

The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Nino to get a loan of 1,900 USD to start her own business. She will purchase refrigerators and stocks of merchandise such as groceries, and open a grocery store.  Nino thinks that the business will be profitable, as it is in a great location and the only business of this kind in the area. After the grocery store is opened, the family will have a stable income which will enable them to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in the future. With the support of the Start Up program, Nino will get an opportunity to increase her productivity and tackle her financial difficulties.

loans.use: To purchase refrigerators and stocks of products to open a grocery store

loans.name: Lennie

texts.en: Lennie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has had a tailoring business in the Philippines for 9 years. She earns additional income from a general store. Lennie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more materials such as fabric, threads, zippers, etc. for her tailoring business. Lennie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more materials such as fabric, threads, zippers, etc. for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more plastic bowls, buckets and general stock for resale.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena, aged 39, is a married woman with three children all of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lorena has had a business selling ready-to-wear clothing for the past nine years in the Philippines. 

Lorena has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of ready-to-wear clothing to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of ready-to-wear clothes to sell

loans.name: Nelson Enrique

texts.es:
Al hablar de  Nelson no se puede notar que es un agricultor de nacimiento criado y formado con los hermosos valores del campo como lo son la humildad y el trabajo, siendo estos dos los más representativos de los agricultores de Colombia.

Nelson, al notar que los ingresos que obtenía como agricultor no eran suficientes para sostener a su familia, decidió montar una tienda para complementar su actividad y mejorar su situación económica.

Hasta ahora ha tenido ciertas dificultades con su capital de trabajo y ha estado un poco estancado, es por esta razón que el señor Nelson solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido para su tienda, básicamente grano, abarrotes, frituras y dulces los cuales complementarían muy bien los ya conocidos productos que vende.

Su sueño es que dios le permita tener salud para trabajar incansablemente y sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en:
On speaking with Nelson, it wouldn't be noticed that he is a farmer by birth, raised and formed with the beautiful values of the countryside, such as humility and hard work, these two being the most representative of the farmers of Colombia.

Nelson, on noting that the income that he was obtaining as a farmer was not sufficient to sustain his family, decided to set up a store to complement this activity and to improve his economic situation.

Up to now he has had certain difficulties with his working capital and has been a little bit stuck. It is for this reason that Señor Nelson is applying for a loan to purchase stock for his store, basically grains, groceries, fried foods, and sweets, which would complement the products that he already sells very well.

His dream is that God will allow him to have health to work untiringly and to raise his family.

loans.use: to buy stock for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect his home to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect her home to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es: Alba Luz: Es una señora amable y luchadora, originaria de Rosita, tiene 40 años, casada con 5 hijos, 3 mayores de edad, dos adolescentes que estudian su secundaria. Cuenta con una experiencia de 13 años de ser docente. Su esposo es albañil. Habita en una vivienda de minifalda de concreto y cemento. Con el propósito de mejorar su vivienda. Solicita su segundo financiamiento para instalarle cerámica a su piso, que actualmente es de cascoque (cemento). Su sueño es mejorar su pozo y viajar a Managua a realizarse estudios médicos.
texts.en: Alba Luz is a friendly and determined woman from Rosita.  She is 40 years old and is married with 5 children.  Three of her children are adults, and the other two are adolescents who are in secondary school.  She has 13 years of experience as a teacher.  Her husband is a bricklayer.  She lives in a small house made of concrete and cement.  With the goal of improving her home, she is requesting a second loan to install ceramic tiles on her floor, which is now made of cement.  Her dream is to improve her well, and to travel to Managua to study medicine.

loans.use: to install ceramic tiles on her floor.

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr:
Célibataire, âgée de 37 ans, Akoua a trois(3) personnes en charge et habite le quartier de Djidjolé. Restauratrice avec la vente du riz depuis 2000, elle est rentré dans le commerce en revendant les friperies et pagnes qu’elle achète au grand marché de Lomé et à Hezdranawè une fois par mois. Akoua revend au marché d’Agbélouvé et les environs de son quartier de résidence. 
Elle sollicite un prêt pour augmenter son commerce en diversifiant le choix des friperies et faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en:
Akou is a 37-year-old single woman in charge of three people; she lives in the Djidjolé district.

She was in food service, having sold rice since 2000, but got started in retail by reselling second-hand clothing and fabric that she purchases once a month from Lomé’s great market and from Hezdranawè. Akoua retail at the market in Agbélouvé, and in the area around her place of residence.

She is requesting a loan to grow her business by offering more choice of second-hand clothes, to increase her profit.

loans.use: To buy 40 pieces of local fabrics and 40 pieces of clothing.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
Meet David who is 34 years of age and a very hardworking farmer who practices mixed farming and is from the Nandi Hills, which is a small town in Kenya. David is married and has three adorable kids that he really adores so much and will do anything to protect them and secure their future. Farming has always been one of the most enjoyable activities in David’s life and he has been doing farming for the past 15 years. Through profits from farming, he has managed to take care of his family and always provides a plate of food for his children and wife. Because of the passion that he has for dairy farming, David has even nicknamed his cow “chebarus “(from a person’s name) and “tumbo “which means stomach, because his cow is so healthy and has got a big stomach.

The Nandi Hills area has high demand for poultry products and David, being an enterprising person, wants to take advantage of this ready market and start poultry farming; that is why he is kindly requesting for a loan from Kiva via Juhudi kilimo to buy poultry. Through the loan, David will not only be selling eggs, but also he will be selling poultry meat and hence he will be making more profits.

Through your loan David is going to deliver the promise of elevating the quality of life and also he is going to secure the future of his children by providing them with the best education.

David's plan is to accumulate more profits and be able to open a large poultry business where he will also be selling meat and poultry food.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Halima has operated a food selling business, making dumplings and flat bread for sale. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase supplies of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 51 years old and married with four children.  

Maribel is in the agricultural business; pig fattening in the Philippines. Maribel requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy piglets, feed, and vitamins for her business.

Maribel has been in the pig fattening business for six years, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maribel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed, and vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a married man who is 46 years of age and living in a rural area with his family of 16 children. He is a business man who deals in a retail shop. He has an additional income from agriculture. He started this business in 1998.

He works seven days in a week and he started this business in order to raise enough income to support his large family and provide the family necessities. He has acquired this loan in order to purchase agricultural produce that is selling cheaply apparently. This will help to sell at a higher price to the city traders and increase his income. His clients are traders from surrounding places.

The challenges he faces are limited capital and price fluctuation. He describes himself as a trustworthy and hardworking man who encourages lenders to reduce on interests.

loans.use: to buy corn and beans.

loans.name: Akuélé

texts.fr: Akuélé est veuve, âgée de 52 ans avec cinq(5) enfants en charge et habite le quartier de Djidjolé.  Akuélé revend  des sceaux plastiques, bassine qu’elle achète au marché d’Adidogomé et les savons ‘’si je savais’’ qu’elle fabrique une fois par mois. Adjovi revend par la vente ambulante  dans les environs de son quartier de résidence. Akuélé sollicite un prêt pour augmenter son commerce afin de répondre aux besoins des clients et faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en:
Akuélé is a 52-year-old widow with five dependent children; she lives in the Djidjolé district.

Akuélé retails plastic buckets and basins that she purchases from the market in Adidogomé, and artisanal palm soap that she manufactures once a month. Adjovi retails door-to-door in the area around her home district. 

Akuélé is requesting a loan to grow her business and meet customer demand, thus increasing her profit.

loans.use: to buy 26 plastic buckets, 26 plastic basins, and 395 pieces of soap.

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr:
Célibataire sans enfant, âgée de 26 ans, Adzo habite le quartier d’Adidogomé. Couturière de formation, elle fait la prestation de service comme couturière et vend les trousseaux bébé à son atelier. Elle achète des tissus deux fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé et fabrique elle-même des trousseaux. 
Adzo sollicite un prêt pour appuyer son activité en mercerie  afin de satisfaire les besoins des clients et faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
Adzo is a 26-year-old single woman with no children; she lives in the Adidogomé district.

A seamstress by training, she provides her services as a seamstress and sells baby outfits from her workshop. She purchases fabrics twice a month from the great market in Lomé, and makes the outfits herself.

Adzo is requesting a loan to support her trade in order to meet consumer demand and increase profits.

loans.use: to buy three rolls of poplin.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 32 years old. She is single and supports a family of four children who are in primary school. Naomi is a farmer, a business she has done for four years now, earning a monthly income of KES. 7,500.

Naomi has requested for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya KES. 15,000, which she will use to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for planting. With the anticipated profits, Naomi will be able to purchase a watering machine for her farm.

Naomi's hopes and dreams are to educate her children to higher levels.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Marcel

texts.en: Marcel is 33 years old, and is married with two children, aged between six and nine. Both of her children are in school, and his wife is a business woman. He sells food stuffs and he has been in this business for the past 10 years. With the loan he wants to buy more beans, sorghum and maize flour for resale. The profit from the business will be used to care for his family and add to his savings, Marcel said. He would like to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more beans, sorghum and maize flour for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies for preparing the land, such as seed and compost, and irrigation.

loans.name: Joan Albeiro

texts.es:
Joan es un hombre que vive en un sector de pocas oportunidades como lo es Sahagún, un sector afectado por la pobreza en la cual poas entidades llegan a brindarles oportunidades de crecer, y más de crecer de creer que pueden llegar a tener un negocio una forma de trabajo sostenible en el tiempo. 

Joan se quiere dedicar  a la venta de carne de cerdo y ahora ve la oportunidad con la entidad interactuar de tener su empresa

Solicita un crédito para la compra de una mesa de acero inoxidable para realizar los cortes y cerdos para distribuir su carne. 
El crédito será de gran ayuda para él porque mejorar sus ingresos, le permitirá operar pues para iniciar su empresa debe tener la mesa  muy necesaria para realizar sus cortes.  Joan tiene dos hijas que dependen de él incondicionalmente y más aún en etapa de crecimiento dado que tiene 6 y 2 años de edad
texts.en:
Joan is a man who lives in Sahagún, a region with few opportunities. The region is plagued by poverty and few institutions bring the people the opportunity to grow and to come to believe that they can have businesses as a sustainable form of work. 

Joan would like to sell pig meat and he now sees an opportunity to have this business through the organization Interactuar. He is applying for a loan to buy a stainless steel table in order to butcher the pig in order to sell the meat. The loan will be a big help for him because he will increase his income. It will let him start and run a business since the table is necessary in order to butcher pigs. Joan has two daughters who depend on him unconditionally as they are still growing since they are 6 and 2 years old.

loans.use: to buy a stainless steel table and a pig.

loans.name: Eter

texts.en:
Eter, who is a 50-year-old married woman and a mother of two sons, lives in the Gori district. The only breadwinner in their family is Eter, who generates a fixed salary from working at the computer store. This income isn't enough to meet all daily costs effectively, and Eter has a great desire to start a parallel activity. 

She requested a loan and was approved with the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, which gives people the chance to be involved in their own businesses. So Eter plans to purchase stock of perfumes at wholesale prices and sell them at increased prices in her community. 

This additional income will be a great support for Eter and her family, enabling them to ease financial difficulties and make a better style of life. Eter awaits your support and will be thankful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase stock of perfume

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice, and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Essavi

texts.fr: Agée de 38 ans Esssavi est divorcée et mère de deux(2) enfants à Adidogomé. Elle fait du commerce en vendant des couches et des détergents,trousseaux au grand marché de Lomé. Essavi s’approvisionne trois fois par mois à Accra au Ghana.Adzo sollicite un prêt pour appuyer son activité afin de satisfaire les besoins des clients et faire plus de profits et prendre soin de ces enfants.
texts.en:
Esssavi is 38 years old, divorced, and a mother of two; she lives in Adidogomé. She retails diapers and detergents at the great market in Lomé. 

Essavi gets her supplies thrice monthly from Accra, in Ghana.

Adzo is requesting a loan to support her business in order to meet customer demand and increase her profits, so that she can take care of her children.

loans.use: to buy three bags of diapers and five bags of laundry detergents.

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère de deux enfants, Massan est âgée de 34 ans et réside à Adidogomé. Elle est revendeuse des produits d’alimentation générale au marché d’Assiyéyé. Massan s’approvisionne deux(02) fois par mois au grand marché de lomé.
Massan sollicite un prêt pour augmenter son commerce en stock de riz  dans le but de répondre aux besoins de ses clients et augmenter de plus son bénéfice.
texts.en:
At 34 years of age, Massan is married and a mother of two; she resides in Adidogomé.

She retails groceries at the market in Assiyéyé. Massan gets her supplies twice monthly from the great market in Lomé.
