Massan is requesting a loan to increase her stock of rice, in order to better meet customer demand and to increase her profit.

loans.use: to buy two bags of rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and rice and expand her traditional medicine.

loans.name: Isaela

texts.es: Isaela de 61 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y un nieto de 16 años de edad. Ella es una mujer luchadora que se gana la vida como empleada en una finca cercana a su localidad. Su compañero de vida apoya en la economía familiar con su trabajo de oficios varios en una residencial. Isaela anteriormente tuvo crédito con FUSAI con el cual compro una puerta de hierro y encementó el piso de su vivienda, además ha demostrado ser una persona responsable con sus pagos y actualmente desea cambiar una parte del techo de su vivienda que se encuentra deteriorada por lo que solicita a FUSAI un nuevo crédito para comprar: lámina galvanizada y madera para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: Isaela, 61, lives with her lifetime companion and a 16 year old grandson.  She is a struggling woman that earns her living working at a farm near her town.  Her lifetime companion supports the family finances through his work at various jobs at a residence.  Isaela previously had a loan with Fusai, with which she bought an iron door and installed cement flooring in her home.  In addition, she has shown herself to be responsible with her payments and currently wishes to replace part of her home’s roof, which has deteriorated. She is requesting a new loan from Fusai to purchase galvanized metal sheets and wood to replace her home’s roof.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized metal sheets and wood to replace her home’s roof.

loans.name: Jose Vicente

texts.es: José de 25 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y su hijo de 6 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se desempeña como motorista de un camión en el cual se venden frutas y verduras, su compañera de vida lo apoya económicamente con su trabajo de ayudante de un comedor ubicado en el mercado central de su localidad. José desea construir un cuarto en su vivienda para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y pagar mano de obra para la construcción del cuarto.
texts.en: 25-year-old José lives with his life companion and their 6-year-old child. He is a hardworking man who drives a track that sells fruits and vegetables. His life companion supports him financially by working as an assistant in a restaurant located in the central market in his town. José hopes to construct a room in his house, which is why he is applying for a FUSAI loan to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and to pay workers to construct the room.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and to pay workers to construct a room in his house.

loans.name: Pascalina

texts.en:
Pascalina is a 41-year-old woman married to Keith who adds additional income to their family, and they are blessed with three children.  Pascalina has been operating a dairy farming business, along with farming as a secondary business, for ten years and is earning herself an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Pascalina was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now requesting her first loan of KES 20,000.  She intends to use this amount to buy animal feed, fertilizers, and seedlings.

Pascalina plans to use the anticipated income to buy an additional dairy cow and hopes to become a large scale dairy farmer.

loans.use: to buy animal feed, fertilizers, and seedlings.

loans.name: Marsha

texts.en:
Marsha is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marsha is 40 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Marsha has a fishing business in the Philippines. Marsha requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase materials like plywood, paint, rope, fishing nets, etc., for her fishing business.

Marsha has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Marsha would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials like plywood, paint, rope, fishing nets, etc., for her fishing business.

loans.name: Rasel

texts.en:
Rasel is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 41 years old and has four children who are in school.

She has a selling ready-to-wear business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell.

Rasel has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready to wear to sell

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosalina is 45 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

She has a rug making business in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for her rug making business.

Rosalina has been in this business for ten years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her rug making business

loans.name: Ruby Estrella

texts.en:
Ruby Estrella is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ruby Estrella is 52 years old and two of her children are still in school.

Ruby Estrella has a frozen food vending business in the Philippines. Ruby Estrella requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more packs of frozen food to sell to her customers.

Ruby Estrella has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Ruby Estrella would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.en:
Theoneste is 34 years old with one child of 10 months. His wife is a farmer.

He has spent four years in his business. With the loan, he wants to buy more beans, rice, groundnuts, potatoes, and cooking oil. The profits from the business will be used to reconstruct his house. And he would like to expand his business to the extent of being a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy more beans, rice, groundnuts, and irish potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Consessa

texts.en: Consessa is aged 20 years old. She is single and her business is selling beans, soya beans, peanuts and maize flour. With the new loan she would like to buy more of these items for resale. She would like to use the profit from the business to add to her savings.

loans.use: To buy more beans, soya beans, peanuts and maize flour for sale.

loans.name: Severina

texts.en:
Severina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Severina requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers.

Severina has been in this business for 20 years now.  She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more assorted drinks, biscuits and mayonnaise for resale.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is 40 years old. He is married to Maureen, and together they have been blessed with one child. Kenneth runs a retail general store where he sells household products and cereals as well. He has run this business for two years, earning a monthly income of KES 30,000.

Kenneth has requested his second loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 40,500.  He successfully repaid his previous loan.

With the anticipated profits, Kenneth will be able to educate his child. His hopes and dreams are to live a stable life and educate his child to higher levels of education.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, and wheat flour to sell.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a 35-year-old woman, married to Jonathan, who adds additional income to their family which is blessed with two children. She has been operating a grocery stall for five years, earning an income of KES 8,000 at the end of every month.

She was introduced to VisionFund Kenya and is now servicing her first loan of KES 20,000 and intends to use the entire amount to buy cabbages, green vegetables, onions, and tomatoes to sell to her customers.

Catherine plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to have a bright future as well as building a permanent house to her family.

loans.use: To add cabbages, green vegetables, onions, and tomatoes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Cecilia de 49 años de edad  vive con el esposo y su hija. Es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogos, tiene mucha clientela por la calidad de los productos y por los buenos precios, con las ventas que realiza y con la ayuda del esposo logran llevar el sustento a su hogar, Cecilia solicita un crédito a INTEGRAL para poder comprar más mercadería como: lociones, maquillajes, cremas, perfumes y otros productos de belleza e higiene personal, etc. y asi poder seguir con sus ventas ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así tener mejores ganancias que le ayuden a darle a su familia  una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Cecilia, 49, lives with her husband and daughter.  She is a hardworking, responsible person engaged in selling beauty products through catalogs.  She has many customers because of the quality and good prices of her products.  She manages to support her household with her sales and her husband’s help.  Cecilia is requesting a loan from Integral to purchase more merchandise such as lotions, make-up, creams, perfumes, and other beauty and personal hygiene products.  In this way, she will be able to continue with her sales as this is her only source of work.   In this way, she will have higher earnings, which will help her to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase lotions, make-up, creams, perfumes, and other beauty and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 53 years old and has two children who are still in school.

She has a rug-making business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more materials for her rug-making business.

Milagros has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her rug-making business

loans.name: Anne Marie

texts.en:
Anne Marie, age 62 years, has 4 children, ages between 8 and 26.  All of them go to school. Her husband is a builder. 

Her business for the past 3 years is to sell food such as beans, sorghum, and maize. With the loan, Anne Marie would like to buy more beans and sorghum to sell.  The profits of the loan will be used to pay school fees for her children. Anne Marie would like to expand her business to the extent of being a food distributor.

loans.use: to buy more beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 32 years old and married with four children. With one child currently in school, Teresita works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, bread, seasonings, cereals, soft-drinks, etc. to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, bread, seasonings, cereals, soft-drinks, etc. 

In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods, bread, seasonings, cereals, soft-drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Valeria

texts.en:
Valeria works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Valeria requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Valeria has been in this business for 20 years now.  She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Henriette

texts.en:
Henriette, aged 23, is married with two children aged between 2 to 6. One of them goes to school, and her husband works as house builder. 

Henriette owns a bar and has been running the bar for the past two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beer and soda for resale.The profit from the loan will be used to save and increase sales. She would like to own her stock and become a distributor in the future.

loans.use: To buy more primus, alcohol, and sodas for resale.

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris works hard to support her family. She is married and has a selling colored roofing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years now.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of colored roofing to sell. Maricris would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of colored roofing to sell

loans.name: Joram

texts.en:
Joram is 43 years old. He is married to Redempta, and together they have been blessed with two children of 11 and 7 years respectively. Redempta is a business lady and provides additional income for her family.

Joram is a retailer, a business he has done for the last 22 years, earning a monthly income of KES 26,800. He has requested his 3rd loan of KES 55,000 which he will use to purchase rice and wheat flour to sell.

With the anticipated profits, Joram will be able to educate his children. His dream is to succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase rice and wheat flour

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Virginia requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Virginia has been in this business for 7 years now.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice appreciates the support of the support of the previous loan that helped her to boost her business.

Here again she comes to you requesting another loan to buy five sacks of charcoal because she is increasing her number of customers and needs to increase her amount of charcoal to meet their demands.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Haylan Group

texts.en:
This group is called Haylan. It consists of four women from the capital city of Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 310,000 YER from AMB.

Fozia is the leader of the group. She is a 36-year-old widow with only one child, who is 18 years old. After Fozia's husband passed away several years ago, Fozia suffered from the hard and miserable condition inside her house. Her husband was the sole breadwinner of the family, but Fozia has a strong and great determination to improve her living standards. She did not surrender to her condition but decided to start her own business to earn money in order to look after her only one child. For many years, Fozia has started her business as beautician with a small amount of capital. Her business has increased more and more, and she earns good profits, but most of that goes to the expenses of her house and to the rent of the beauty parlor. To further expand her business, Fozia applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase makeup and cosmetics for her beauty parlor. 

Fozia looks forward to opening a large beauty parlor to do more expanding.

loans.use: to purchase makeup and cosmetics for her beauty parlor for further expanding.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man, aged 36 years, with seven children who go to different schools. 

He is an agriculturalist who deals in the growing of beans, maize, and coffee. He works for five days a week and ten hours a day and he has been in this produce business since 2008, due to the fact that he wanted to generate income for survival of his household.

He is also a salary earner and owns rentals from which he gains an additional income to support his family. He hopes to use the loan to buy more corn and coffee to sell to his customers. He normally sells his products to fellow farmers in Rakai and neighboring trading centers.

David's hopes and dreams are to increase on his income. He however faces a challenge of natural calamities like drought which affect his business.

He is described as an honest and hard working man in business and asks lenders to introduce grace periods so that clients benefit more from these loans.

loans.use: to purchase coffee and maize

loans.name: Niño De Praga  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Niño de Praga está conformado por 7 mujeres emprendedoras, triunfadoras y profesionales quienes se conocen hace muchos años, tienen una gran amistad y laboran en diferentes actividades económicas. Viven por un hermoso sector de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es desde 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, esta bañada por 4 ríos los cuales le dan una magia especial, cuenta con muchos lugares turísticos, es de clima frió y su gente aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Alexandra, forma parte del grupo de crédito Niño de Praga desde hace 2 años tiempo en el que ha establecido una más estrecha amistad con todas sus vecinas y amigas, le gusta esta forma de créditos porque en cada reunión sale de su rutina diaria de trabajo así como también los créditos son para mejorar su pequeño negocio.
La Señora. Alexandra tiene 28 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña de 9 años  que está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad, la casa en la que vive es de sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar.
Doña Alexandra es enfermera y se encuentra ejerciendo su profesión, trabaja en una institución pública desde hace 3 años, en este trabajo labora en turnos rotativos, pero para mejorar mas su estabilidad económica se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo como ropa y cosméticos. El dinero de su crédito va a  invertir en la compra de ropa y cosméticos de  promoción. Su sueño es tener un negocio propio y rentable para construir su casa.
La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The credit union, "Niño de Praga," is made up of seven entrepreneurial, triumphant, and professional women who have known each other for many years. They have a great friendship and work in various jobs. They live in a beautiful sector within the city of Cuenca which is a 1999 World Heritage Site. The city is surrounded by four rivers which give it a special charm. It has many tourist locations and has a colder climate. They people still maintain the culture and traditions of their towns. 

One of the group members is Alexandra. She has been part of this credit union, "Niño de Praga," for two years - time which she has established close friendships with all of her neighbors and friends. She likes this loan process because each meeting comes out of her daily work routine and the loans also help improve her small business. 

Alexandra is 28 years old and a single mother of a 9-year-old girl who is studying at a small school in town. They live in a house owned by her parents and share living expenses with them. Alexandra is a nurse and is currently practicing. She has worked in a public institution for three years. In this job, she works rotating shifts. However, in order to improve her economic stability, she also sells products like clothing and cosmetics through a catalog. The money from this loan will be invested in the purchase of  promotional clothing and cosmetics. Her dream is to have her own business and profits to build a home. 

The small photo is of one member who was unable to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Santiago de 41 años de edad reside en casa propia con compañera de vida y sus 4 hijos de 16,15,12 y 10 años de edad. Él es un hombre tenaz que se gana la vida como albañil, además cuando se le es requerido se desempeña como jornalero y cultiva maíz y frijol para consumo, también su hijo aporta a la economía familiar por medio de su trabajo. Santiago desea comprar el derecho de agua potable  dado que no cuenta con el servicio qué es tan vital en un hogar, por lo anterior solicita un crédito a FUSAI para pagar el derecho de agua potable y comprar materiales para la instalación.
texts.en: Santiago is 41 years old and lives in his own home with his life partner and their four children, who are 16, 15, 12 and 10 years old. He is a man of great perseverance who earns his living as a builder. He also works as a day labourer when there is demand for his services, and grows maize and beans for household consumption. His son also contributes to the family finances by working. Santiago wishes to purchase his entitlement to drinking water, as he does not currently have this service, which is so vital for a home. He is therefore seeking a credit from FUSAI in order to pay for his right to drinking water and to buy materials needed for its installation.

loans.use: to pay for his right to drinking water and buy materials for its installation.

loans.name: Liliane

texts.en:
Liliane, age 45, has 3 children between ages 12 and 21.  All of them go to school, and her husband is a farmer.  

Liliane runs a supermarket, which she has been running for the past 8 years. With the loan, she would like to add more merchandise such as biscuits, bread, and sugar to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to have enough savings. She would like to expand her business to the extent of having 1 million RWF as capital investments in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more biscuits, bread, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Reina Esperanza

texts.es: Reina, tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijas con quienes vive en un sector del municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Doña Reina tiene su propio negocio de compra y venta de artesanía, entre los diseños están animales, jarrones decorados, bases para macetas, adornes para pared etc. y son de buena calidad. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa y vende por pedidos, además elabora y vende pasteles y repostería para generar otros ingresos. Ha mantenido estas actividades mediante la inversión de varios prestamos, actualmente solicita otro por 15,000 lempiras para comprar mas artesanía y cumplir con los pedidos. Tiene como plan seguir creciendo con los negocios.
texts.en:
Reina is 49 years old. She is a single mother who has two daughters with whom she lives in an area of the municipality of Choloma, Cortes.

Reina has her own business buying and selling artisanal crafts. Among the good-quality designs are animals, decorated vases, bases for plant pots, wall adornments, etc. She has this business in her house, and she takes orders. She also makes and sells cakes and pastries to generate additional income. She has maintained these activities through the investment of several loans. She is currently requesting another 15,000 lempiras [HNL] in order to buy more crafts and fill her orders. She plans to continue growing her businesses.

loans.use: to buy artisanal crafts to sell

loans.name: Jose Alexander

texts.es: Alexander de 25 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida en la casa que empezó a construir con el primer crédito que solicito a FUSAI en el cual demostró ser un hombre muy responsable. Él es un hombre emprendedor que desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en un camión. Alexander desea terminar de construir su vivienda, instalar energía eléctrica y comprar 2 puertas de hierro  para lo que solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI con el cual comprará: cemento, arena, grava, 2 puertas, balcones y ventanas para terminar de construir y organizar su vivienda.
texts.en: 25-year-old Alexander lives with his life companion in a house that he began to build with the first loan that recieved from FUSAI. He has demonstrated that he is a very responsible man. He is an entrepreneurial man who has sold fruits and vegetables from a tuck for 4 years. Alexander hopes to finish constructing his house, installing electrical energy, and buying 2 iron doors which is why he is applying for a new loan from FUSAI. With it, he will buy cement, sand, gravel, 2 doors,i ron bars, and windows to finish constructing and organizing his home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, 2 doors, iron bars, and windows in order to finish constructing and organizing his home.

loans.name: Sandra Alicia

texts.es: Sandra de 27 años de edad es madre soltera y vive con su hija de 2 años de edad. Ella es una mujer tenaz que se dedica a la venta de verduras y hortalizas en el mercado central de su municipio. Sandra desea construir un cuarto de ladrillo y cemento en su propiedad ya que actualmente su vivienda esta hecha de bajareque por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava y hierro, además deberá pagar mano de obra para la construcción del cuarto.
texts.en: Sandra, 27, is a single mother who lives with her 2 year-old daughter.  She is a tenacious woman who has a business selling vegetables in the central market of her city.  Sandra wants to build a room on her property, with bricks and cement.  Currently, her home is made of woven reeds and mud.  This is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel, and steel.  In addition, she will use the loan to pay for labor to build the room.

loans.use: to build a room

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, soap, Vaseline and toothpaste for resale.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan es un ventero que ha dedicado toda su vida a la comercialización de productos de aseo, zapatos y ropa en general, comenzó su negocio como solución a los problemas económicos que tiene su familia y con los que poco a poco ha venido solucionando.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de mercancía en aseo general y zapatos con los que pensara mejorar sus ingresos ya que ofrecerá mayor variedad a sus clientes y sus ventas no pararan y no tendrá que desistir de su negocio. 

Su sueño es seguir manteniendo el negocio y llegar ampliarlo y generar mayores recursos para tener una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Juan is a salesman who has dedicated his whole life to selling cleaning products, shoes, and clothing. He started his business as a solution to the financial problems that his family has; he has been solving those problems little by little.

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of general cleaning merchandise and shoes, with which he is planning to improve his income. He will offer greater variety to his customers, his sales will not stop, and he won't have to give up his business.

His dream is to continue running his business, eventually expanding it and generating greater resources in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products and shoes

loans.name: Kosgei

texts.en:
HELLO LENDERS! Meet Kosgei, a 42-year-old father of 7 adorable children that always bring a pleasant feeling when they are all at home. He hails from the Eldoret area of Kenya, an area that is a city of champions. Being a father of 7 comes with lots of responsibility and feeding this large family requires a lot of hard work and hence Kosgei has to put in extra efforts to comfortably take care of his family.
Kosgei started farming just after finishing  high school since he never advanced his education and because of the high unemployment rate he ventured into farming and he has never regretted this because of the profits he has been making.    
Kosgei practices mixed farming and is regarded as one of the hardworking farmers in his village because he is able to juggle between keeping dairy cows and also doing crop farming.
Kosgei is a visionary and enterprising person and has always wanted to do dairy farming in large scale but one of the challenges he has faced is lack of enough capital. That is why he is kindly seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow. Through the loan Kosgei is confident that his life will be transformed and his dream of providing a secure future for his children will be achieved. Kosgei is relieved to know that his life can be secured through partners such as Kiva lenders who help small scale and aspiring men such as Kosgei.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr:
Marie  est mariée et mère d’un enfant dans le quartier d’Adidogomé. Elle est âgée de 43 ans et exerce comme activité la vente de charbon de bois. Elle s’approvisionne une  fois par mois à Notsé qu’elle revend au marché d’Assiyéyé.
Marie  sollicite un prêt pour faire plus de stock afin de faire des bénéfices considérables.
texts.en: Marie is a married mother of one child in the Adidogomé district. She is 43 years old and has a business selling charcoal. She gets her supplies once a month in Notsé and resells her merchandise at the Assiyéyé market. Marie is requesting a loan to have more inventory in order to make considerable profits.

loans.use: to purchase 28 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es una mujer trabajadora, tiene 35 años de edad, es soltera, tiene 2 hijos y vive en Chincha junto a su familia.
Tuvo que sacar adelante a sus hijos sola porque no tenía el apoyo de su pareja pero eso no fue un obstáculo para ella. Actualmente ha podido superarse y trabaja como Profesora de Educación Inicial, le va muy bien porque es muy emprendedora, luchadora y ama trabajar con niños porque dice que son el futuro del país y necesitan una buena formación desde pequeños.
Es la segunda oportunidad que Kiva confía en Elizabeth y le brinda su apoyo, en esta ocasión ella utilizará la ayuda brindada para iniciar un proyecto en el Colegio y para que de esta manera los niños puedan aprender más, para que sus clases sean más didácticas. Con esto ella se sentirá satisfecha porque crecerá profesionalmente y también apoyará en la mejora del futuro del país. Gracias a esto Elizabeth seguirá esforzándose para ser una mejor profesora y también para darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking woman, 35 years old, single, and with two children. She lives with her family in Chincha.

She had to take care of her children by herself because she didn't have the support of her partner, but that wasn't an obstacle for her. Now she has been able to overcome and works as a Teacher of Beginning Education, which is going quite well for her because she is very enterprising, a warrior, and she loves working with children because, she says, they are the future of the country and need a good education from when they are small.

This is the second time that Kiva trusts Elizabeth and offers her their support. Now, she will use the help offered to begin a project in the school, so that in this way the children can learn more and their classes can be more didactic. This will make her feel satisfied, because she will grow professionally and also give her support to improving the country's future. Thanks to this, Elizabeth will continue working to be a better teacher and also to give the best to her family.

loans.use: to start a project in the school where she works

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise to run a ropes and sacks business.

loans.name: Mario Jose

texts.es:
El señor Mario Jose es un habitante del municipio de condega, a unos 35 km al norte de la ciudad de Estelí, es un obrero que está felizmente casado y tiene un hijo en edad infantil, él es conocido como una persona trabajadora y de buenas relaciones con sus vecinos.
Este cliente en la actualidad labora como vigilante en el cuido de las instalaciones de una bodega que aloja maquinarias y utensilios de construcción, él tiene más de 16 años de laborar en esta institución de manera continua siendo esta su principal fuente de ingreso para su sostén familiar.
Él se presentó a las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un nuevo financiamiento con el fin de comprar materiales de construcción, tales como ladrillos y cemento para la construcción de una pila séptica en su casa de habitación. él se muestra positivo y espera el crédito le sea aprobado y poder llevar a cabo esta mejora en su casa de habitación que en un futuro mejorara las condiciones de vida del cliente y su familia y vivir dignamente
texts.en:
Mario Jose lives in the municipality of Condega, about 35 km north of the city of Estelí. He is happily married and has one infant child. He is known as a hard-working person who gets on well with his neighbours. He works as a security guard, looking after a warehouse where construction machinery and tools are stored. He has been working for the same company for more than 16 years, and this provides his main source of income to support his family.

Mario Jose came to CEPRODEL's offices to seek a loan with the aim of buying construction materials, such as bricks and cement, in order to build a septic tank in his home. He has a positive attitude and hopes that the loan will be approved, and that he will be able to carry out this improvement to his home, which in the future will improve living conditions for him and his family, and give them greater dignity in their lives.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks and labour to build a septic tank.

loans.name: Peterson

texts.en:
Peterson, a 31-year-old married father of four children, two of whom attend school, lives in Mabale-Kidda village where he is a farmer as well as a businessman.  As a farmer since 2007, Peterson grows passion fruits and tomatoes, and as a businessman, he has a veterinary shop specializing in farm supplies in Mabale-Kidda trading center. Working six days a week, he sells his agricultural products to city traders who usually take them every two weeks. 

Peterson hopes to become the leading producer of passion fruits and tomatoes in Mabale, but he has problems with pests and disease which attack the crops, and weather conditions which are unpredictable. He is requesting this loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his passion fruits and tomatoes.

Peterson thanks the Kiva lenders for the job well done.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Tamilla

texts.en:
Tamilla, a 51-year-old woman, lives in Marneuli district. Her husband died several days ago and the family was left without a source of income. Tamilla has only one school-aged son and they live in poverty. In order to generate some income and somehow cover even basic needs Tamilla decided to start a small trading business. She requested a loan at several financial companies, but was rejected as having no business experience and any other source of income. At last her application was financed from MFO Credo, that has a joint initiative with Kiva; the start up program gives poor people a chance to start their own businesses. 

Tamilla plans to purchase a stock of fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices and sell locally at increased prices. This will be a huge support to her  family, as she will be making the only source of income for fighting against poverty and in the future she also wants to expand her activity. Tamilla and her son rely on your good will and kindness and look forward to your help.

loans.use: To start trading with fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr:
Mariée sans enfant Massan est âgée de 29 ans et réside à Adidogomé. Elle est revendeuse de mèches et tissages à la devanture de son domicile. Massan s’approvisionne deux(02) fois par mois au grand marché de lomé.
Massan sollicite un prêt pour augmenter son commerce en stock de mèches et tissages afin de répondre aux besoins de ses clients et augmenter de plus son bénéfice.
texts.en: Married but with no children, Massan is 29 years old and resides in Adidogomé. She is a reseller of hair extensions and weaves in front of her home. She gets her supplies twice a month at the big market in Lomé. Massan is requesting a loan to increase her business inventory of hair extensions and weaves in order to respond to the needs of her customer and also to augment her profits further.

loans.use: to purchase 39 hair extensions and 30 weaves to sell

loans.name: Corina

texts.en:
Corina, a Peruvian artisan who works alongside her business partner, Jesus, specializes in 100% alpaca apparel. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of alpaca yarn for her sweaters. Corina has been selling through NOVICA since 2013. This is her story: 'We met when we were children, and though we lived apart, we kept in touch through the years. Jesus learned to weave from his mother and grandmother, and in 2012 he suggested we form a society together. At first I wasn't sure, but we kept talking about it and two months later, I accepted the proposal and this is why I'm in this field now. We've been working on small projects but we're looking for ways to export our designs. Jesus is in charge of weaving and I take care of the administration, but I'm also learning to design sweaters. Jesus and I make a great team — I've learned a lot about the textile arts and I really admire his dedication to this work. We hope to do much more and, with the grace of God, we expect to be able to. We love what we do and are involved in all the details of creating our apparel. Everything you receive from us is made with much love and dedication by two young entrepreneurs who are seeking success. We're giving this project everything we've got.' 'I'd like to thank you all for helping us grow through this microcredit. It will allow us to purchase the yarn we need to produce a large supply of sweaters.' Use the link below to view Corina's 100% alpaca apparel on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/9019

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of alpaca yarn for her sweaters

loans.name: Gaspar

texts.es:
Que bendición es cuando los padres le heredan a los hijos los recursos para que éstos forjan un mejor futuro.

Es el caso de Gaspar, residente de Sololá, joven de 27 años, padre de una niña de tres años y una bebé de 11 meses quienes tendrían las mismas manos que segurirán forjando algún día la misma tierra que su padre.

Gaspar se dedica a la siembra de papa y de zanahoria que le productos que luego los vende en el mercado del pueblo.

El préstamo que él solicita es para la compra de insumos agrícolas como abonos, semillas, entre otros, para que de esta manera obtener una buena siembra y cosecha, y como resultado obtener buenas ganancias de un buen producto.
texts.en:
What a blessing it is when parents pass down to their children the resources to help them forge a better future.

This is the case of Gaspar, Solola resident, a young man of 27, father to a three-year-old girl and a baby of 11 months, who have the same hands which will continue one day to forge the same land as their father.

Gaspar works planting potatoes and carrots, products which he later sells in the town market.

The loan he is requesting is to buy agricultural supplies like fertilizer, seeds, and other things, so that in this way he can get a good planting and harvest, and as a result, obtain good profits from a good product.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Rory está en su ciclo número  14 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde gracias al trabajo de cada una están mejorando poco a poco su situación de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Margarita, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, lo que quiere decir que a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de chipas y golosinas que hace está saliendo adelante. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y sacrificada.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar más chipas, que es un alimento típico de Paraguay, y también para la compra de golosinas varias, para poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
The Kuña Rory group are in their 14th cycle of the women's committee program, where they all work and help each other to get ahead. They are doing the poverty elimination survey, where, thanks to the work of each one of them, they are improving their poverty situation little by little. 

One of the members is Margarita, who in her last survey showed a poverty level of three, which means that through her effort and continuous work, and by selling 'chipas' (a traditional Paraguayan bread) and sweets, she is getting ahead. She is a very hardworking and sacrificing woman.

She is requesting this loan so she can buy more 'chipas,' which are a typical Paraguayan food, and also to buy various sweets, so she can continue with her sales.

loans.use: to buy 'chipas' and various sweets to sell

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr: Veuve  âgée de 37 ans, Adjovi a un enfant en charge et habite le quartier de Djidjolé. Elle est rentrée dans le commerce en revendant les friperies de vêtements qu’elle achète au grand marché de Lomé et à Hezdranawè une fois par mois. Adjovi revend au marché d’Agbalépédo et les environs de son quartier de résidence. Adjovi sollicite un prêt pour augmenter son commerce en diversifiant le choix des friperies et faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en: A widow, aged 37, Adjovi has one child to support and lives in the Djidjolé district. She has returned to commerce by reselling secondhand clothing, which she purchases at the big market in Lomé and in Hezdranawè once a month. Adjovi resells her merchandise at the Agbalépédo market and around the district where she lives. She is requesting a loan to increase her commerce by diversifying the choices of used clothing and to make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase 100 pieces of clothing, 160 culottes, and 150 men’s undergarments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy zinc-coated steel sheets and wood, and  to pay for manual labor to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Nekha Jubbo De Ndiapto Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit, qui porte le nom de » Nékha Jubbo de Ndiapto » rassemble des femmes qui habitent le même village et qui s’activent toute dans l’agriculture. La dame Adama est la responsable du groupe, c’est elle qui se trouve à gauche sur la photo. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle possède un grand champ qu’elle exploite avec son mari et ses enfants. Elle vient solliciter au nom du groupe, un crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter des semences, de l’engrais, des pesticides pour cultiver.
Adama nourrit de grands projets car elle veut faire en plus de la culture du mil et de l’arachide, de la culture maraichère, de l’embouche bovine et de l’aviculture. En collaborant avec une Institution financière comme IMCEC, elle pense pouvoir réaliser son ambition.
texts.en:
The loan group, which bears the name “Nékha Jubbo de Ndiapto”, brings together women who live in the same village and who are all active in farming. Ms. Adama is the group’s official. She is the one at the left in the photo. She is a married mother and owns a large field, which she along with her husband and children are making use of.

Adama is here to request a loan on behalf of the group that will enable her to purchase some seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides for farming. She fosters big plans, since she wants to have a market garden, to fatten cattle, and to be a poultry farmer in addition to growing millet and peanuts. By collaborating with a microfinance institution such as IMCEC, she thinks she can realize her ambitions.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides for farming

loans.name: Kuña Aty 4 Vientos Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina KUÑA ATY 4 VIENTOS cuenta con dieciséis integrantes, están en el 6to ciclo, todas las mujeres que conforman este grupo son muy trabajadoras y con sentido de compromiso.
 Una de ellas es la Sra. Dolly que con su esfuerzo y trabajo diario va prosperando en su farmacia, es muy amable y tiene muchos clientes. Ella quiere invertir en su farmacia para poder ir creciendo y luchando por mejorar su vida y la de su familia.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de medicamentos para poder surtir su farmacia, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
This loan group is called "Kuña Aty 4 Vientos" (Kuña Aty Four Winds). It has 16 members, and they are in their sixth loan cycle. All the women who make up this group are very hard-working and have a sense of commitment.

One of the members is Señora Dolly, who with her effort and daily work is prospering in her pharmacy. She is very friendly and has many customers. She wants to invest in her pharmacy to be able to continue growing and striving to improve her life and that of her family.

She is requesting this loan to purchase medications to be able to stock her pharmacy so that she can continue with her work as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy various medications for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Gie Book Jom De Niéne Sérère Group

texts.fr:
Le Groupe d’intérêt Economique(GIE) Book Jom de Niéne Sérère, regroupe des hommes qui s’activent dans diverses activités génératrices de revenus dont le principal est l’agriculture. Le responsable est monsieur Khady Ibrahima, marié et père de famille. Il s’active dans l’agriculture depuis plus de 10 ans. Il veut renforcer son activité avec le crédit sollicité, il va acheter des semences, de l’engrais et des pesticides pour cultiver son espace cultural.
Il a comme projet futur, de faire de l’embouche bovine et ovine et d’exploiter d’autres parcelles lui appartenant.
texts.en: The economic interest group (EIG) named “Book Jom de Niéne Sérère” is composed of men who are active in diverse revenue-generating businesses, of which the main one is farming. The group’s official is Mr. Khady Ibrahima. He is a married father and has been active in farming for over ten years. He wants to bolster his business with the loan he is requesting. He is going to purchase some seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides for farming his land. For the future, he is planning to fatten cattle and sheep and to make use of other plots of land belonging to him.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer to make use of their land

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es: Mariano tiene 68 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Sololá, departamento de Sololá, solicita nuevamente crédito para invertir en el cultivo de zanahoria, anteriormente no podía cultivar una extensión grande por no contaba con capital, Mariano solicita Q. 3,500.00 para comprar insumos (semilla de zanahoria, abono orgánico, abono químico) para el cultivo de zanahoria, al obtener el crédito puede darle el mantenimiento necesario para obtener una buena cosecha y mejorar la calidad del producto, con las ganancias Mariano piensa comprar ropa para su familia.
texts.en:
Mariano is 68 years old. He lives in the city of Sololá, in the department of Sololá. He is requesting a new loan to invest in his cultivation of carrots. Formerly he was unable to farm a large area because he did not have the capital.

He is requesting 3,500 GTQ to purchase supplies (carrot seed, organic fertilizer, chemical fertilizer) for his carrot farming. When he receives the loan he will be able to do the necessary maintenance in order to insure a good harvest and improve the quality of his crops. Mariano intends to purchase clothing for his family with his profits.

loans.use: to buy potato and carrot seeds.

loans.name: Gabriela Marisol

texts.es: Gabriela  de 33 años de edad es una persona trabajadora y responsable quien vive con el esposo, su  hija y su madre, se dedica a la venta de diferentes productos como esmaltes, diademas, colas para el cabello, etc.  con lo que gana de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar las necesidades de su hogar, Gabriela esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de  mas productos por mayor y asi surtir mas su negocio y tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Gabriela is 33 years old and is a hard-working and responsible person who lives with her husband, her daughter and her mother.  She works in selling different products such as nail polish, headbands, hair rubber bands, etc. With her earnings from sales and the help of her husband, they are able to meet the needs of their home.  Gabriela is requesting a loan to purchase more products in bulk and as a result, expand her business more and have a better quality of life together with her family, without any limitations.

loans.use: to purchase nail polish, headbands, hair rubberbands, etc. at wholesale.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es: Marta de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia, con su esposo y su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de productos desechables como vasos,  platos, servilletas, etc.  su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia con lo que gana de sus ventas logra satisfacer las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, Marta solicita un crédito para la compra de productos desechables por mayor y asi seguir con sus ventas y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Marta is 43 years old and lives in her own house, with her husband and her daughter.  She works selling disposable products such as cups, plates, napkins, etc. Her business is located in her residence.  With what she earns in sales, she is able to meet the necessities of her home.  Marta is requesting a loan for the purchase of disposable products in bulk so that she can continue with her sales and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase cups, plates, napkins, etc. and disposables at wholesale

loans.name: Sop Mame Babacar 11" Beug Manal Sa Bop" Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Sop Mame Babacar 11 est un sous groupe d’un réseau de femmes transformatrices de produits halieutiques. Il est composé de cinq femmes qui s’activent depuis plusieurs années et qui se sont regroupées pour bénéficier d’un appui financier qui leur permettra de renforcer leurs activités génératrices de revenus. La responsable, madame Seynabou, a une expérience de plus de 10 ans. Elle achète du poisson frais pour le transformer en poisson fumé et séché pour ensuite le revendre.
Seynabou appui son époux dans les charges de la maison. Elle rêve de construire sa propre maison un jour.
texts.en:
The loan group “Sop Mame Babacar 11” is a subgroup of a network of women who process seafood. The group is composed of five women, who have been active for several years and who have come together to benefit from financial support enabling them to bolster their revenue-generating businesses. 

The group’s official is named Ms. Seynabou, who has over ten years of experience. She purchases fresh fish in order to produce smoked and dried fish, which are then resold. Seynabou supports her husband in covering household expenses. She dreams of building her own house one day.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to process and sell

loans.name: Sop Mame Diarra 11 "beug Manal Sa Bop" Group

texts.fr: Le groupe de crédit Sop Mame Diarra 11 est un sous groupe d’un réseau de femmes transformatrices de produits halieutiques. Il est composé de cinq femmes qui s’activent depuis plusieurs années et qui se sont regroupées pour bénéficier d’un appui financier qui leur permettra de renforcer leurs activités génératrices de revenus. La responsable s’appelle Seynabou, mariée et mère de 3 enfants, elle s’active depuis plus de 10 ans dans la transformation de poissons frais en poissons fumés et séchés destinés à la commercialisation. Seynabou s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne du foyer. Elle veut devenir un jour, une grande exportatrice de ces produits.
texts.en:
The loan group “Sop Mame Diarra 11” is a subgroup of a network of women who process seafood. The group is composed of five women, who have been active for several years and who have come together to benefit from financial support enabling them to bolster their revenue-generating businesses. 

The group’s official is named Seynabou, a married mother of three. She has been active for over ten years in the processing of fresh fish into smoked and dried fish to be marketed. Seynabou takes care of day-to-day expenses of the household. She wants to become a major exporter of these products one day.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to process and sell

loans.name: Sop Mame Babacar 9" Beug Manal Sa Bop" Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Sop Mame Babacar 9 est un sous groupe d’un réseau de femmes transformatrices de produits halieutiques. Il est composé de cinq femmes qui s’activent depuis plusieurs années et qui se sont regroupées pour bénéficier d’un appui financier qui leur permettra de renforcer leurs activités génératrices de revenus. La responsable, la dame Fatou est mariée et mère de famille. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans ce domaine. Elle achète du poisson frais pour le transformer en poisson fumé et séché afin de le revendre.
Fatou participe aux charges de la maison. Elle veut aussi développer son autre activité de restauration qui marche aussi bien dans cette zone.
texts.en:
The loan group “Sop Mame Babacar 9” is a subgroup of a network of women who process seafood. The group is composed of five women, who have been active for several years and who have come together to benefit from financial support enabling them to bolster their revenue-generating businesses. 

The group’s official is Ms. Fatou, a married mother. She has over ten years of experience in this domain. She purchases fresh fish and then produces smoked and fried fish to be sold. She helps to cover household expenses. She also wants to develop another business involving food service, which does well in this area.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish to process and sell

loans.name: Noe Alexander

texts.es: Noé de 20 años de edad vive con sus padres y 3 hermanos. Él es un joven trabajador que desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras de forma ambulante en el mercado central, sus hermanos también aportan a la economía familiar gracias a sus trabajos. Noé desea construir un cuarto para la cocina en su propiedad por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava y hierro, además deberá pagar mano de obra para la construcción del cuarto.
texts.en: Noé is 20 years old and lives with his parents and three siblings. He is a hard working young man that has earned a living for the last three years selling fruits and vegetables as a street vendor in the central market. His siblings also support the family financially, thanks to their jobs. Noé wants to build a room for the kitchen in his home. That is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI, to buy cement, sand, gravel and metal. He must also pay for the labor to construct the room.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel and metal and to pay for the labor to construct a room.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa  de 50 años de edad es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura siembra maíz, adicional a eso también se dedica a la crianza de ganando, su cosecha la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarlos en los alrededores de la zona donde reside, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, Rosa está solicitando a INTEGRAL un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y así poder continuar con sus siembras ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poder tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is 50 years old. She is a very responsible and hardworking person. She has been farming corn for several years. In addition, she also raises cattle. She stores her harvest in the silos shown in the photo and then sells it in areas near her residence. She lives in a house that she owns with her family.

Rosa is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to purchase seed, fertilizer, compost, pest controls, etc. Thus she will continue with her farming since that is the only source of work. This will enable her and her family to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer, compost, pest controls, etc.

loans.name: Ntarusaku Group

texts.fr:
Néhémie  fait partie du groupe  Ntarusaku  et  habite à Bubanza. Il  a 60 ans et est marié à  Pélouce, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 13  à  18 ans tous étudient.

Il fait le commerce de  boutique (riz, haricot, savon, …)  depuis 20 ans.  

Il est à son deuxième crédit   à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va augmenter son capital et   acheter  200 kilos de haricot, 200 kilos de riz, 22 kilos de sel,  à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, il  voudrait construire une maison et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Néhémie is part of the group Ntarusaku and lives in Bubanza. He is 60 years old and married to Pélouce, a merchant. Together they have five children, from 13 to 18 years old, of whom all are students.

Néhémie has been doing commerce as a shopkeeper (rice, beans, soap,…) for twenty years. 

He is on his second Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and purchase 200 kg of beans, 200 kg of rice, and 22 kg of salt to resell, so as to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to build a house and to see his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase 200 kg of beans, 200 kg of rice, and 22 kg of salt to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Doña ILIANA tiene 63 años de edad. Vive en Lagarto (Bocana) con su hija de 36 años 3 nietos y un sobrino que esta criando desde muy pequeño.
Su hija no tiene trabajo estable. Eventualmente la invitan a descabezar camarón y puede ganarse unos centavos- ella es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos de edad escolar.
ILIANA ya gestiona su segundo crédito. Con el crédito anterior pudo iniciar el mejoramiento de su casa. La misma que era de paredes de caña de bambú – e invirtió en una mini tienda de productos de primera necesidad.
Con este nuevo crédito. Se abastecerá de productos enlatados, arroz azúcar, panela para brindar a sus clientes una variedad completa de productos frescos a buen precio y además seguir arreglando su casita.
Ella en 3 años espera haber remodelado su casa, tener una tienda más grande porque sus deseos a futuro es tener un supermercado y dar trabajo a jóvenes que no tienen oportunidad en su comunidad.
Menciona que FODEMI es una buena institución que ayuda al pobre a trabajar con préstamos a bajo interés y sin el requerimiento de muchos documentos.
texts.en:
Doña Iliana is 63 years old. She lives in Lagarto (Bocana) with her daughter, who is 36, three grandchildren, and a nephew whom she has been raising since he was very little. Her daughter doesn't have steady work. Occasionally they ask her to de-head shrimp and she can earn a few centavos. She is a single mother and has three children of school age.

Iliana is already negotiating her second loan. With the previous loan she was able to begin improvements in her house, which had walls of bamboo cane, and she invested in a mini store with basic necessities.

With this new loan, she will stock the store with canned goods, rice, sugar, and unrefined whole cane sugar so that she can offer her customers a complete variety of fresh products at good prices, and in addition she will continue getting her house in shape.

She hopes in three years to have remodeled her house and have a bigger store, because her wishes for the future are to have a supermarket and give work to youths who have no opportunities in her community.

She mentions that FODEMI is a good institution that helps the poor to work with loans at low interest and without the requirement for many documents.

loans.use:
to stock her store with canned goods, rice, sugar,  and unrefined sugar to offer her customers a complete variety of fresh products at a good price, and also to 
continue getting her house in shape

loans.name: Sop Mame Babacar 4" Beug Manal Sa Bop" Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Sop Mame Babacar 4 est un sous groupe d’un réseau de femmes transformatrices de produits halieutiques. Il est composé de cinq femmes qui s’activent depuis plusieurs années et qui se sont regroupées pour bénéficier d’un appui financier qui leur permettra de renforcer leurs activités génératrices de revenus. Madame Alimatou est la présidente de groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans ce domaine. Avec le crédit, elle va acheter une charrette de poissons frais, de l’herbe pour fumer le poisson et du sel. Le produit fini sera du poisson fumé et/ou du poisson séché. Alimatou appuie son mari dans les charges de la maison.  
Comme projet futur, elle désire augmenter son capital afin de produire beaucoup plus et d’aller vendre vers d’autres régions du pays.
texts.en:
The loan group “Sop Mame Babacar 4” is a subgroup of a network of women who process seafood. The group is composed of five women, who have been active for several years and who have come together to benefit from financial support enabling them to bolster their revenue-generating businesses. 

Ms. Alimatou is the group’s president. She is a married mother. She has over ten years of experience in this domain. With this loan, she is going to purchase a cart of fresh fish, some herbs for smoking the fish, and some salt. The final product will be smoked and/or salted fish. Alimatou supports her husband in covering household expenses. 

For future plans, she wishes to increase her capital to produce more and to sell in other regions of the country.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to process and sell

loans.name: Norte Poty Group

texts.es:
El comité Norte Poty,  cuenta con quince miembros, han pasado al 3er ciclo. Contentos y agradecidos por la oportunidad de inversión que se les brinda a través de la Fundación Paraguaya y kiva, de a que a través de su esfuerzo puedan ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida. 
Elizabeth es una de ellas, quien tiene su propio negocio de comidas, que con mucho sacrificio fue montando y hoy, gracias al buen trabajo que hace, y a las delicias que prepara, ya es conocida en los alrededores, su sueño es poder seguir creciendo, y en miras a ese sueño es que se está esforzando.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para hacer comidas, como carne, verduras, fideos, arroz y demás por cantidad, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The committee Norte Poty has fifteen members and they have passed the 3rd cycle. They are happy and grateful for the investment opportunity that is offered to them by the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva.  And it is through these efforts that they can continue improving their life conditions.

Elizabeth is one of members who has her own food business, which with a lot of sacrifice has been growing growing and today, thanks to the good work that she does and the delicious food she prepares, she is already known in the area.  Her dream is to continue growing and that is a dream that she is working towards.  She is asking for this loan to buy more supplies to make meals such as meat, vegetables, noodles, rice and others by bulk, because that way she can continue the work she is doing.

loans.use: to purchase meat, vegetables, noodles, rice and more by bulk.

loans.name: Kijumbu Group

texts.fr:
Félix  fait partie du groupe  Kijumbu  et  habite à Bubanza. Il  a 30 ans et est marié à  Sandrine, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants l'un a 4 mois et l'autre 4 ans.

Il fait le commerce de viande  depuis 4 ans.  

Il est à son deuxième crédit   à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va augmenter son capital et   acheter 5 chèvres afin d' avoir une grande quantité de viande   à revendre, pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, il  voudrait acheter un véhicule de transport et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Félix is part of the group Kijumbu and lives in Bubanza. He is 30 years old and married to Sandrine, a merchant. Together they have two children, a 4-month-old and a 4-year-old. 

Félix has been doing commerce in meats for four years. 

He is on his second Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and to purchase 5 goats to have a large amount of meat to resell, so as to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to buy a vehicle for transportation purposes and to see his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase 5 goats to have a large amount of meat to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Sop Mame Babacar 1" Beug Manal Sa Bop" Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Sop Mame Babacar 1 est un sous groupe d’un réseau de femmes transformatrices de produits halieutiques. Il est composé de cinq femmes qui s’activent depuis plusieurs années et qui se sont regroupées pour bénéficier d’un appui financier qui leur permettra de renforcer leurs activités génératrices de revenus. La responsable, Ndèye Marème est mariée et mère de 4 enfants qui sont scolarisés grâce à sa participation dans la gestion de la maison. 
Ndèye Marème a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité qu’est la transformation de poisson frais en poisson fumé et en poisson séché destiné à la commercialisation. Les bénéfices lui serviront à gérer ses besoins personnels. Elle veut hisser son activité à un plus haut niveau voire à exporter vers d’autres zones.
texts.en:
The loan group “Sop Mame Babacar 1” is a subgroup of a network of women who process seafood. The group is composed of five women, who have been active for several years and who have come together to benefit from financial support enabling them to bolster their revenue-generating businesses. 

The groups’ official, Ndèye Marème, is a married mother of four children, who are in school, thanks to her help in managing the household. Ndèye Marème has good experience in this business domain processing fresh fish into smoked fish and dried fish to be marketed. The profits will be used to manage her personal needs. She wants to raise her business to a higher level, indeed to export to other areas.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to process and resell

loans.name: Eber Enrique

texts.es: Eber de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus hijos, desde hace varios años se dedica a la elaboración y  venta de cuadros así como los que muestra la fotografía, sus hijos y su esposa le ayudan a la elaboración de los mismos y es así como logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, tiene clientela ya establecida por la calidad de los cuadros que vende, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, Eber solicita un crédito para la compra de de materiales para la elaboración de cuadros como: tela, pintura de colores, madera, papel, moldes, etc. y asi poder seguir con su trabajo que es su única fuente de ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Eber is 32 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and their children. For several years he has earned his living by creating and selling framed paintings like those shown in the photo. His wife and children help him, and this work is how he manages to meet the costs of the household. He has regular customers thanks to the high quality of his pictures, which helps him to make enough for the family's needs.

Eber is seeking a loan in order to buy materials needed for his pictures, such as canvas, coloured paints, wood and paper. This will enable him to continue with his work, which is his only source of income, and give his family better financial security.

loans.use: to buy canvas, coloured paints, wood, paper, and other materials.

loans.name: Ubumwe Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Ngarukuye est une brave commerçante, dynamique,  entrepreneur depuis 20 ans, présidente et membre du groupe d’Affaires «Ubumwe», âgée de 51 ans,  mariée et mère de 7 enfants, qui tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse divers articles et sociétaire d’une alimentation. Elle étale ses activités au parking a la sortie de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter des pains, saucissons, beignets, biscuits, produits de nettoyage, etc. Son conjoint est sans emploi. Elle bénéficia son premier capital de son mari, quand il fut employé. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite renforcer ses activités,  scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs  non bancables.
texts.en:
This client, Ngarukuye, is a good and honest merchant, an entrepreneur for twenty years, and the president and a member of the business group “Ubumwe”. She is 51 years old and a married mother of seven children, all provided with education. She sells a variety of items and is an associate of a grocery store. She displays her merchandise in the parking lot at the town’s exit. 

She is requesting a loan from Hekima to grow her business. She is going to purchase some breads, sausages, beignets, cookies, cleaning products, etc.  Her husband has no job. She benefited from initial capital from her husband when he was employed. 

For the future, she would like to bolster her business  and provide education, clothing, and food for her children. She thanks Hekima for its support of unbanked women entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase breads, sausages, beignets, cookies, cleaning products, etc.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es: Rigoberto de 57 años de edad es una persona trabajadora con buenas referencias por parte de  sus vecinos, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos,  desde hace 30 años se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz, y comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona, con lo que vende logra llevar el sustento a su hogar, Rigoberto solicita un crédito a INTEGRAL  para la compra de abono, fertilizantes, herbicidas, controles de plagas, etc. Para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rigoberto is 57 years old and is a hard-working person whose neighbours speak well of him. He lives with his wife and their two children. For the last 30 years he has earned his living as a farmer; he grows maize, and sells what he produces in the local area. With what he sells he manages to bring home enough to support his household. Rigoberto is seeking a loan from Apoyo Integral in order to buy manure, fertilisers, herbicides, pesticides, etc, and so give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilisers, herbicides, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Bon Berger Group

texts.fr: Gakuba est commerçante et membre d’un groupe d’affaires «Bon Berger», entrepreneur, âgée de 35 ans, mariée  et mère de 6 enfants, dont 4 étudient et 2 sont encore petits. La cliente est une vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle étale sa marchandise dans un marché  de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Son conjoint, lui aussi est commerçant. Il y a 10 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 3 sacs d’haricot et  5 sacs de pommes de terre.  Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser, vêtir, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays. Il sied de signaler qu’une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
Gakuba is merchant and a member of the business group “Bon Berger”. An entrepreneur, she is 35 years old and a married mother of six children, of whom four are students and two are still little. This client is a vendor of grocery items. She displays her merchandise at market in town. She started her business with funds from her husband, who is also a merchant. She has been in this business for ten years. 

This new loan will be used to purchase 3 sacks of beans and 5 sacks of potatoes. Thus, she would like to provide education, clothing and food for her children. 

In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for supporting autonomy among unbanked women entrepreneurs, especially during this critical time post-conflict in the country’s east. It should be noted that one client is holding her baby.

loans.use: to purchase 3 sacks of beans and 5 sacks of potatoes

loans.name: Heshima Group

texts.fr: La cliente Eliza est une commerçante et membre de l’association d’affaires «Heshima», entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont 4 étudient et 2 sont encore gamins. La cliente est une vendeuse des planches de constructions de meilleure qualité. Elle stocke sa marchandise dans un dépôt sur la route principale.  Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance de son mari. Son conjoint est un technicien menuisier. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 8 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité.  Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 15 planches. Ainsi, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, scolariser, vêtir, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables.Il sied de signaler que certains clients portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
This client, Eliza, is a merchant and a member of the business group “Heshima”. An entrepreneur, she is energetic, 38 years old, and a married mother of six children, of whom four are students and two are still little. This client is a vendor of the best quality lumber for construction. She stocks her merchandise at a warehouse on the main road. 

She started her business with help from her husband, who is a furniture technician. Later on, she benefited from a loan from the microfinance institution Hekima. She has been in this business for eight years. This new loan will be used to purchase 15 boards. In this way, she would like to purchase a parcel of land and provide education, clothing, and food for her children. 

In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for supporting autonomy among unbanked women entrepreneurs, especially during this critical time post-conflict in the country’s east. It should be noted that some clients are holding their babies.

loans.use: to purchase lumber

loans.name: Sop Mame Diarra 6" Beug Manal Sa Bop" Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Sop Mame Diarra 6 est un sous groupe d’un réseau de femmes transformatrices de produits halieutiques. Il est composé de cinq femmes qui s’activent depuis plusieurs années et qui se sont regroupées pour bénéficier d’un appui financier qui leur permettra de renforcer leurs activités génératrices de revenus. La responsable, Ndiabé est mariée et mère de famille. Elle s’active depuis plus de 10 ans. Son activité consiste à l’achat de poisson frais, de sel et d’herbes pour fumer le poisson dans des fours destinés pour cela. Et après avoir enlever les écailles, le produit devient du poisson fumé destiné à la commercialisation. Avec les bénéfices, elle appuie son mari dans les charges de la maison.
Ndiabé rêve de devenir une grande exportatrice de poisson fumé dans d’autres régions.
texts.en:
The loan group “Sop Mame Diarra 6” is a subgroup of a network of women who process seafood. The group is composed of five women, who have been active for several years and who have come together to benefit from financial support enabling them to bolster their revenue-generating businesses. 

The groups’ official, Ndiabé, is a married mother and has been active for over ten years. Her business involves buying fresh fish, salt, and herbs for smoking the fish in ovens. Then, after removing the scales, the final product is smoked fish to be marketed. With the profits, she supports her husband in covering household expenses. Ndiabé dreams of becoming a major exporter of smoked fish to other regions.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to process and sell

loans.name: "lamp Fall" Port 7 "beug Manal Sa Bop" Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Lamp Fall Port 7 est un sous groupe d’un réseau de femmes vendeuses de poissons et transformatrices de produits halieutiques. Il est composé de cinq femmes qui s’activent depuis plusieurs années et qui se sont regroupées pour bénéficier d’un appui financier qui leur permettra de renforcer leurs activités génératrices de revenus. La dame Bineta, est la présidente du groupe, elle est mariée et mère de famille. Cela fait plus de 10 ans qu’elle travaille au port en achetant pour revendre, du poisson frais. Avec le crédit, elle pourra augmenter la quantité de poisson achetée.
Son rêve à elle, sera d’acquérir une pirogue, d’employer des hommes qui iront chercher le poisson en mer cela maximiserai son profit.
texts.en:
The loan group “Lamp Fall Port 7 ” is a subgroup of a network of women who process seafood. The group is composed of five women, who have been active for several years and who have come together to benefit from financial support enabling them to bolster their revenue-generating businesses. 

Ms. Bineta is the group’s president. She is a married mother. She has been working for over ten years at the port buying and selling fresh fish. With this loan, she will be able to increase the amount of fish purchased. Her own dream is to acquire a boat and employ men who will go get the fish in the ocean. This will maximize her profit.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish for commercialization

loans.name: "lamp Fall" Port 6 "beug Manal Sa Bop" Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Lamp Fall Port 6 est un sous groupe d’un réseau de femmes vendeuses de poissons et transformatrices de produits halieutiques. Il est composé de cinq femmes qui s’activent depuis plusieurs années et qui se sont regroupées pour bénéficier d’un appui financier qui leur permettra de renforcer leurs activités génératrices de revenus. La présidente s’appelle Seynabou, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle travaille au port depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle tient une étale et le crédit lui servira à acquérir du poisson pour le revendre. Seynabou participe à la dépense quotidienne car c’est elle qui se charge de fournir le poisson à consommer pour le repas de la famille.
Son ambition c’est d’acquérir des pirogues et un moteur puissant pour les permettre d’aller en haute mer chercher du gros poisson.
texts.en:
The loan group “Lamp Fall Port 6 ” is a subgroup of a network of women who process seafood. The group is composed of five women, who have been active for several years and who have come together to benefit from financial support enabling them to bolster their revenue-generating businesses. 

The group’s president is called Seynabou. She is a married mother of four. She has been working at the port for over ten years. She has a stall, and the loan will be used to acquire fish to resell. Seynabou helps to cover day-to-day expenses, since she is the one responsible for furnishing fish to eat at family meals. Her ambition is to acquire boats and a powerful motor enabling them to get fish on the high seas.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to commecialize

loans.name: Khelcom 4" Beug Manal Sa Bop" Group
